Thank you for commenting on your recent stay.

We apologize for any inconvenience you encountered during your visit. Please rest assure that we will address your comments with our Concierge team.. 


We do provide complimentary wifi in our hotel lobby, while the in-room internet system is bundled up with the telephone system allowing guests to make unlimited local and domestic long distance calls within the US and Canada, for $12.95 per day.

Upholding our commitment to guest service excellence, we hope to serve you better in the future.
 
Sincerely,

review.title: Will not station on a Marriot again!
review.reviewText: 1. Concierge chose his computer reading to assisting us.  2. The bath tub was dangerous to stand in. 3  the bar to help enter shower was on the wrong wall.  4. Bathroom had no shampoo etc upon arrival. 5. No free wi fi

managementResponses.response:

Thank you for commenting about your recent visit.

As a valued guest, we are sorry to hear that you are disappointed with the amenities we provide. We do provide complimentary wifi in our hotel , lobby, while the $12.95 wifi in the guestrooms do include unlimited local and long distance call within the US and Canada, as opposed to many hotels that charge for these calls.

Sincerely,

review.reviewText: The only thing going for this hotel is its location. Extremely over priced. No ammenties that a Best Western doesnt provide. Even the Holiday in  across the street provides free wifi. Would recommend researching other locations nearby.

review.title: Front desk staff was the best!
review.reviewText: San Francisco has so much for everyone.  Our hotel was was luxurious with beautiful rooms, views of the city, friendly staff and wonderful food.  We walked over to Fisherman's Wharf, enjoyed the street musicians, shopping and great restaurants with views of the bay and Golden Gate Bridge.  This was our favorite vacation!
review.positiveRemarks: The front desk receptionist was efficient, helpful and friendly.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel was close to Fisherman's Wharf and San Francisco Bay.

managementResponses.response:

Warm regards from all of us at the San Francisco Marriott Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Room with a view does NOT mean view of the ocean.
review.reviewText: Noise level should be monitored. The party near one of our rooms lasted until 3:15 AM.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was good. Check in receptionist gets a PLUS!
review.negativeRemarks: The room and bath décor was rather ordinary for an all star hotel.
review.locationRemarks: The Cable Car museum was a real gem!!

review.title: Hotel Near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The Marriott Fisherman's Wharf was a clean, comfortable hotel. Unfortunately, the price per night does not come with any amenities - you have to pay for wifi and to use the business center. The concierge was also not very friendly and told us to come back and speak with another representative the next day. We also were not able to check in when we arrived because their keycard machine was down. All in all, although the location is good, I would not stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel location is the best feature.
review.negativeRemarks: Offering wifi to guests is something that the hotel should do; people need it to discover new things to do in town.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39 and the Ferry Building are in walking distance and fun to explore.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: My family stayed here for my parents 70th.  Hotel was nice enough to send my parents a complimentary bottle of champagne.  Hotel is in a great location.  Walking distance to ghirardelli square and fishermans wharf.

review.title: Fisherman a Warft Hotel

Location was great.
Valet car parking was expensive (no pre-booking is needed)

Check in was very quick and all of the staff members we encountered were very friendly and helpful.  The hotel was clean and comfortable.  We enjoyed our stay here.

review.title: Family Trip to the City by the Bay!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay!  The hotel is ideally located near the wharf, ghiradelli, and transportation.  The rooms were clean, staff very attentive.  I thought we booked rooms with double queens, they were doubles so I was disappointed with Expedia and Marriott.  Doubles were tight, we had 4 rooms with kids in each room.  Beautiful place though. managementResponses.response:

Greetings from Marriott Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Very Average - Nothing Special
review.reviewText: Very close to the Pier and other touristy things.  Close to Trader Joe's and Safeway grocery stores.  Everything is pretty average, including the service.  Sure, they have fresh cookies out at 4pm for check in - but you will never see them.  They have free umbrella's for when it's raining out, if there are any left.  The food and bar are way over priced and is always empty.  Parking is Valet only and is way more expensive than all the other hotels near by.
review.negativeRemarks: Didn't like how the Valet expected a tip every time we drove our car.  We drove our car 2x a day and would prefer to park it ourselves.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to fill out a guest review. Your comments are greatly appreciated and will aid us in our commitment to guest service excellence. Thank you for your nice comments about the staff.  We do pride ourselves on providing the highest possible level of service and product to our guests.

Staff very friendly

review.title: Close to beach.
review.reviewText:
Not worth the money or the valet fee! Stay across the street at the holiday inn. Fees are less AND breakfast is included. 
My original flight was cancelled (which I booked on Expedia) and couldn't make it to the check in date. I called Marriott and asked them if possible to switch to the next night due to the flight cancellation. They said to call Expedia. Expedia did a conference call with myself and Marriott and they said its up to manager discretion and they won't switch it. Mind you there were still many available rooms for this same night. (Since they noted that the decision was based on the fact that they sold out-huh lie)! Will never recommend Marriott again nor stay there-ever. 
This happened once before with holiday inn and there were no questions asked, they changed the room date. (This was out of my control as well).
All in all Expedia ended up paying for the next night for me due to the flight cancellation. Connie, the supervisor at Expedia, stayed on the phone with me until I was squared away and she was able to credit some additional fees. Thank you Expedia for all the assistance you have me. Great customer service experience. I'm sticking with holiday inn from now on. They always get it right for me!

review.title: id give it a 2.5
review.reviewText: Front desk clerk said maybe five words total. No amenities included. I stayed at Marriott I. Los Angeles and the beds were remarkable. This one didn't have the same bed. Hard mattress. It was clean inside. No continental breakfast and if you did want to order plan on additional $50-75 for two. I stayed at holiday inn the night before and I would have given that a higher rating. Plus a free breakfast. I don't need to pay for the name if I'm not going to be taken care of the way I need to be.

review.title: Close to the fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: It is walking distance to the wharf and restaurants.

The hotel was clean and the staff friendly.  The hotel is centrally located for tourism.  You have to walk only three blocks to catch the city sights double decker bus.  I recommend the 8 AM restaurant, which is just a block away.
Close proximity to Fishermans Wharf. Cleanliness and comfort

review.title: Everyone at the hotel was very accommodating. The
review.reviewText:
The location was awesome. It was walking distance to all the fun things on the wharf. It was easy access to many find restaurants. 
 The only downer was the $50 charge for parking. I thought that was quite extravagant. That would be the only reason I would not stay there again. The hotel itself and the staff were fabulous.
 Even if they only charged $30 a night like many other hotels it would have made all the difference in the world. The Marriott is known for its find training of their staff and for them to be accommodating. I hope They take note and include a parking package with your hotel room.

review.title: ok hotel close to fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: Good location, friendly staff, fast check-in, expensive parking. Hotel needs renovation.
review.negativeRemarks: bathroom needs updating, dirty arm chair, expensive parking
review.locationRemarks: Near shopping, restaurants, park, beach.

review.reviewText: After a bad start at reception where we were told that the room we had booked through Expedia could not be provided with a rollaway bed ( despite requesting one with the booking), we were offered a junior suite at a competitive rate. The rest of our experience was fine with friendly, helpful staff. I get the feeling that Marriott doesn't like Expedia bookings.

review.title: Great Ubication
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice and with a great location near to the Fisherman's Wharf. I recommend it.

review.title: Average for  Mariotte, I expected more.
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was adequate but I expected more.  Ate in dining room several times only to find utensils, napkins & food on the floor in an empty room, and there was always a chill. The cleaning staff repeatedly left dirty dishes in the room, failed to empty the ice bucket and leave clean towels, despite the ice bucket & dishes being gathered in one obvious place, and the dirty towels left on the floor. Understanding that this is a busy hotel, the service was substandard in my opinion.  I would think twice before recommending this location or staying here again myself.
review.positiveRemarks: The bathroom was clean, and while the bed was not very comfortable, it was good size and clean.  The pillows were very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Training for the cleaning staff on what to remove/replace and clean in a hotel room.  Front desk staff could use more training on customer relations.
review.locationRemarks: The location was excellent, centrally located and close to the waterfront, dining, shopping and sightseeing.

review.title: Clean hotel close to get to where ever you wish

review.locationRemarks: Go out to restaurants (ex: Original Joes) ! Visit the Palace of Fine Arts if big crowded places is not your thing.

review.title: 6 Blocks from Fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText:
Just spent one night there for New Years Eve. They have a little restaurant/bar in the lobby. It was safe and a good place to meet up with family and friends. I had a chicken caesar salad and it was good except the dressing was so salty I couldn't eat the whole thing. 

The architecture of the hotel is plain and the halls were downright boring. But the room was comfortable. Here's the thing people. when you spend literally hundreds on a room and you don't have wifi except in the lobby??? People we have to object to this. Make sure hotels know we travelers expect wifi to be included in the fee.
review.positiveRemarks: Bed and room was very comfortable. Central location. Delicious coffee for free in the lobby in the morning
review.negativeRemarks: Free wifi would be good in the room
review.locationRemarks: I walked around the block at night and didn't see anything. During the day you could walk to fisherman's wharf, Pier 39, the Marina, the Buena Vista..

One big problem of this Hegel is no free self parking, and the valet park under the hotel requires about 50 dollars per night, and the pay self parking is 5-10min walk, a public parking, and the fee is also expensive. If you park over 12 hours, just one night need 40 dollars. Everything in this hotel is good, but the parking which make the room fee increase a lot

Lovely flexibility with check out to help us out in a rainy day. Easy.
Met expectations...clean, friendly staff, great location.  Would absolutely stay there again.

Hotel is close to the wharf but for a family of 4 it is not a comfortable or economical place to stay.  Hotel concierge and staff were really nice to work with but that is about it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Will not stay ther next time we visit.

review.reviewText: We very much enjoyed our stay at this hotel, it is very close to Fishermans Wharf and we walked everywhere. Complimentary coffee set up in the morning was great! Room was nice and clean and pet friendly! Breakfast was delicious and plenty of choices for all tastes. Lobby bar was very nice also. We will be back!

over all experiences is good. The location of the hotel is perfect! Just took me 5 minutes to walk to fisher man's Wharf. And zipcar are right located across the street. It's very easy for you to get around. Only thing is worthwhile to mention is the internet is not free, so get ready to pay for it while you stay.  Over all experiences staying this hotel is good. Staff in the hotel they are pretty nice and helpful. And you could get shuttle service to the airport (with charges). I recommend everyone need to have some idea of the transportation while they stay in this hotel.

review.title: Perfect location!
review.reviewText:
We booked through Expedia. We had a Marriott reward card.  When we checked into the hotel, the front desk informed us that when booking through a 3rd party, we aren't supposed to get free wifi in our room (even with a Marriott reward number).  One couple that travelled with us had no issues even though they also booked through Expedia.  In the end, we reluctantly did get free wifi in our room.  Consistency??

The hotel itself is older, but very clean.  It's central and walking distance to many touristy sites.  I would definitely stay in the same vicinity again.

review.title: Convenient location and close to the wharf
review.reviewText: My courtyard view room was clean, comfortable, and quiet.  The hotel is just a few blocks away from the wharf area and close to the Masons-Powell cable car turn-around.  There's also a couple of breakfast spots nearby, if you rather not eat in the hotel.  The staff was courteous and helpful.  If you need to rent a car for the day, check with the concierge.  The hotel had a deal with Enterprise car rental, so we were able to reserve the car at the hotel, go out to have breakfast, then walk a few more blocks and get our rental car.  This was my 1st trip to San Francisco and I wouldn't hesitate staying here again!

review.title: Nice but expensive beyond quoted price
review.reviewText: We had to use the hotel parking garage at an extra charge of $60 per day ($300 for our stay plus tips for bringing it around. Also the buffet breakfast was $75 for 2 persons and while it was very good thst was too much. We only ate there the first morning.

review.negativeRemarks: It feels a little dated, even though it's clean. Carpeting looks worn, coloring older.

review.title: King Jesus
review.reviewText: Great! By the grace if God we were able to enjoy His beauties!!!

review.title: Best hotel stay yet
review.reviewText: They were very nice, late check in flight got delayed but was able to check in at 1am. Very clean and very friendly staff. Awesome place to stay

review.title: Loud, dirty
review.reviewText: Only paying for location, hotel is nothing great. The walls are paper thin you can hear everything in the surrounding rooms, outside, and rooms above you.

review.title: The hotel was two blocks from fisherman's wharf.
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and the staff was accommodating.
Great location near Warf. Not great for downtown proximity if you're staying here for work.

review.title: Central hotel for fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: We stayed two nights, much better than we expected, central, and yet quiet, no views of bay, safe parking but a bit pricey- $54 a night. staff were friendly and helpful. Have rated slightly lower for- facilities- as no pool but there is so much to do around didn't really matter, and room comfort- as one of the beds was uncomfy- but that could just have been because two teenage siblings sharing as no rollaway allowed. there are the usual local taxes added on the final bill which did increase the price somewhat! We would return to this hotel as apposed to the one we stayed in a few years ago.
review.positiveRemarks: it was centrally located to the wharf
review.negativeRemarks:
leave out complimentary tea and coffee, although do have facilites in room. 
cheaper valet parking
review.locationRemarks: hotel is in a great location for the city for tourists, near all the main sites.

review.title: Walking distance to fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel is older but very clean and staff are all nice. Our room was kept clean the whole time. 2 blocks away from Fisherman's wharf. Walking distance to pier 39, Lombard street, ghirardelli square, the cannery and the cable car station. Close to the office of the City sightseeing hop on hop off tour. Denny's, Walgreens and Starbucks right around the corner as well. Overall, would stay again...

review.title: Tourist
review.reviewText:
Very nice hotel, but I hated the location.  I chose that hotel to be closer to pier 39, but Fisherman's Wharf is overcrowded with tourist.  This review is no reflection at all on the hotel, but more to do with my preference to avoid large crowds.  Boy did I puck the wrong place for that.

If I just had to review the hotel I would say that the hotel rooms were clean, quiet and very comfortable.  Staff was extremely helpful.  Buffet was overpriced at about $35 and the food was just ok.  The bar scene was what you would expect.  Nice bartenders, and again, the food was just ok.

If you don't mind crowds, or you are a tourist visiting san fran for the first time, this would be a great location and hotel for you.
review.negativeRemarks: Improve the food.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of touristy stores at Fisherman's Wharf.  Pier 39, (10 minute walk) is WAAAAAAYYYYYY better.

review.title: Nice hotel. But just ok
review.reviewText:
We arrived at this hotel at  midnight. the person in the front desk was very dry and borderline rude. The next day, had breakfast there, which was ok, but definitely overpriced. We spent $73.00 for two adults. 
It cost $54 per night to park here. Valet staff was very nice, diligent and helpful. Bar staff incredible too. The people in the restaurant gave us some recommendations for activities and they were on point. 
If you stay here, please know there are several other less costly options for breakfast if you just step outside of the hotel. The hotel is in the middle of everything. And the beds are very comfortable. room was a bit small for us.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel beds definitely a plus. Valet and restaurant staff super outstanding. Maid also went above and beyond to be nice to us.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking and breakfast price
review.locationRemarks: Nice fisherman's wharf. Girardelli square. Trolly also near by.

review.title: Had an excellent stay
review.reviewText: Spent the weekend in SF for a swim event at South End Rowing Club. This hotel is very convenient.

review.title: Nice hotel, very centric!
review.reviewText: Went for vacations and found a great hotel to stay.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf, Ghirardelli Square, Lombard Street, Little Italy and Chinatown

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This is a wonderful hotel in an excellent location.  If you're considering a visit to San Francisco, then be sure to stay at this hotel.  The staff is friendly and helpful.

review.title: Nice and quiet hotel near the ocean.
review.reviewText: It was a clean hotel  close to the ocean with many sights to see. Hopefully I come again to this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was very close to everything. There are alot of places to eat across the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe, have the hotel cleaned even after 3pm.
review.locationRemarks: There is fisherman wharf a couple of blocks of way, where you could eat or rent  a bike

review.title: Great location/tired hotel
review.reviewText: Fab location close to all things Fishermans Wharf.  Like many Marriott's the hotel is a bit tired.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: We loved SFO.  the Marriott is located at a walk distance from fisherman's wharf  Love it!

review.title: Marriott Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: My family and I stayed at the Marriott for three nights.  The staff was the best.   Even though our room didn't have a city view it didn't matter since we were only in our room to sleep.   Location couldn't have been better.   Two minute walk to Fishermans wharf and what an awesome experience that was.   A warning if you want a tour of Alcatraz, you need to call at least a month or so in advance to get tickets during the summer months,  we didn't get to go.  We took the boat tour under golden gate and around Alcatraz and enjoyed every second.

review.title: Guest Service was top notch.....
review.reviewText: The Guest Service was excellent. From the valet to check out everyone was on their A game.  Location was perfect for the Wharf and other amenities.
review.negativeRemarks: Taxis keep blocking the entrance to Valet.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermen's was just a few blocks down the street.  Other amenities were also a few steps away.

review.title: Marriott Fushermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Very nice staff, clean good size room and great location. Drawbacks: not enough mirrors or outlets when room is full and no pool.

review.title: Good if you want to be near the wharf
review.reviewText: Limits how far you can walk without taking a cab or public transportation. Breakfast was OUTRAGEOUSLY expensive and much better food at half the cost a block away.
Great hotel, clean, beds are very comfortable, great staff, great location, I would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great hotel in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We had a great experience.  The staff was awesome and they comp'd our Wi-Fi for the five days we were there.  Room was nice,  pretty basic but very clean and pleasant.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was awesome.  1 1/2 blocks from the piers.
review.negativeRemarks: No complaints
review.locationRemarks: Quick walk to all of the touristy stuff.  Pier 39,  aquarium,  shopping.

review.title: Nice hotel in the Fisherman's Wharf area.
review.reviewText: Great location with an easy walk to the wharf and all the Piers.  Room was nice with OK beds.  Concierge was very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Slight improvement to rooms, but overall nice.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.  Near the wharf and piers.  Easy walk to most everything.  Close to bike rentals as well.

review.title: Fine hotel with great people
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location, but its greatest assests are its people. You won't find a more helpful staff anywhere. For example, our car to take us the Amtrak train depot didn't come because it was stuck in traffic miles away. The hotel consierge worked to get us another car as soon as possible during the moring rush hour when cars were sarce. He got us a car and we made our train on time.
review.negativeRemarks: No improvements needed.
review.locationRemarks: Just a couple of blocks from Fisherman's Wharf -- a great location for all activities in San Francisco

review.title: Too expensive but close to attractions
review.reviewText: Price is way too expensive.  The room was just a normal room.  You had too pay for everything.  If you wanted bottle water it was 4.50.  If you wanted wi-go it was 12.50.  Normal hotels don't charge these fees.

review.title: Good location, staff not very helpful with luggage
review.reviewText: We had 5 people with 5 bags and they suggested a cab versus a shuttle.  They said 15 mins - went doen they hadn't even called.  When my husband was lifting the bags up the stairs, the bell man said, there is a ramp over there and did not offer to help until the taxi came and opens the doors and expected a tip
Nice Hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf and a lot of attractions. Hop on Hop off bus stop located close to the hotel for easy walking. Breakfast buffet was pricey for what was available.

review.title: Good location, close to the Pier
review.reviewText: They would not take my reward card, the room was not clean, there was a lollipop stuck to the floor between beds and white comforters had visible stains on them.. kind of gross.  Rooms are small, the beds were terribly uncomfortable, and god forbid you opened up the $5 water bottle left on the counter!!  YIKES...
review.negativeRemarks: For a Marriott, it could be more accommodating..
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's pier is a blast, close to Ghirardelli and Lombard St.  So much to do in SF, LOVE IT!!!

review.title: Fishermans wharf in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: So close to the action but back just enough for quiet when needed.  We ate from the breakfast buffet and off the menu.  Food was great.  Beds, pillows. Shower great. No fan in the bathroom though.  TV on the small size, otherwise a great choice.

review.title: hotel on fishermans wharf but
review.reviewText: good location but hotel not up to my expectations for a 4 star Marriott hotel. Actually I was shocked when we arrived at hotel. from the lobby, checkin counter,  room, totally underwhelmed, small, small, small. I guess location was reason for price. on the plus side, although the room was small, we had a good bed and shower.
review.negativeRemarks: size can't be changed, maybe better decor may help with ambiance.
review.locationRemarks: convenient to fisherman's wharf restaurants, shopping, and activities.

review.title: Good
review.reviewText:
It was reasonable, clean and safe 
Helpfull and comfortable

review.title: Close to fisher and wharf
review.reviewText: It was way over priced for what we got. It was only a place to stay. $54 for parking and no breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: They brought me coffee set ups
review.negativeRemarks: Free breakfast so I didn't have to leave to find something cheaper than a  $20 breakfast

review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, bed was very comfortable & the location was within walking distance to many attractions.  Problems:  You had to pay for Wi-Fi.  I never had to pay for that before this stay.  Also, even though the location was good, people were yelling outside our window every night and made it difficult to get a good nights sleep

Very friendly and helpful staff at every level. Great access to Fishermans wharf, Gharidelli's, Embarcadero, cable car pick up--all areas easily within a 5-10 min walk. Good restaurants close by also.
Very expensive and no free internet inside the rooms (you have to pay extra). The place looks outdated. This is definitely not one of the best Marriott properties.

review.title: 2 day stay at the Marriott
review.reviewText: Fantastic location near Fisherman's Wharf. Easy walk to everything. Friendly and helpful staff. Super comfortable rooms. Was very pleased with everything during our stay. Even gave us a discount on parking.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfort and location near Fishermen's Wharf
review.negativeRemarks: Parking a bit expensive.

review.title: Location Location, Location
review.reviewText:
The Marriott Fisherman Wharf is in a perfect location! From there, you have shopping, restaurants, excursions and easy access to see the places you go to see SF. 
Uber is available 24hrs, and they can be used to get you where you want for a reasonable price. 
The hotel may be alittle noisy during the day, but it's only due to the location to everything! At night, the noise dies down, and we slept like babies! The food at the hotel is a little pricey, but there is tons of restaurants surrounding the hotel! My wife and I spent 5 days in SF to celebrate our 18th anniversary, and had the best time of our lives. We would recommend the Marriott Fishermans Wharf to ALL groups! 
Thank You Marriott for a great stay!

review.title: great time
review.reviewText:
the Hotel was exceptional in every way from the bell staff to the desk,the room was great plenty of drawer space and
a large closet to hang you clothes always clean very conveniet to all of things to see
review.negativeRemarks: can't think of anything
review.locationRemarks: close to all things in San Francisco the on and off tour,the Trollys  the Wharf just down the street

review.title: Walking distance to fisherman's wharf

review.title: Review
review.reviewText: Great location couldnt do enough for us and let us check in early

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf visit
review.reviewText:
I enjoyed staying at this hotel.
It has excellent facilities, excellent staff, and a good location.
I also enjoyed walking and siteseeing in the area around the hotel.

review.title: Not what I expected booking a room at a Marriott.
review.reviewText: Although the location was superb and the staff was wonderful, this hotel was not what I expected when I booked a Marriott. It felt more like a two star hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walking distance to multiple tours, Fisherman's Wharf, cable cars.

review.reviewText: The hotel is old but updated. The parking fee of $54 per day was outrageous.

review.title: Nice place.
review.reviewText: Great location and very helpful staff.  The breakfast bar seemed expensive but was convenient.  Would highly recommend.
Nice hotel, great location. Staff was friendly and helpful. Only negative was the cost of valet parking, $54 plus tax a night.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed our three night stay. Awesome location, close to everything. Parking fee is outrageous, I found a garage one block over for less than 1/2 the price. Definitely pays to shop around for a deal (or don't bring a car).  the staff was very friendly, and the hotel has a free washer and dryer.

We stayed for 3 nites, it was quiet at nite, comfortable bed, nice bathroom, good furnishings.
Overall it was a very pleasant stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Not so much a view - it's either the street or court-yard view: Let's have a little colored lite at nite towards the center fountain at least Marriott
review.locationRemarks: Everything is within walking distance from FW-M. Even Chinatowns' is within walking distance, if you are somewhat fit (killer hills tho).

review.title: Would definitely stay here again.

review.negativeRemarks: Better pillows!
review.locationRemarks: So much is available within walking distance.

review.reviewText: Convenient walking to Aquatic Park, Ghirardelli, Fisherman's Wharf, restaurants in North Beach.

review.title: Great choice and lacation
review.reviewText: Clean, fresh, good location, friendly, safe area. Cable car not worth the wait lines for a days pass.
Had a great stay in SF! This hotel was clean, friendly service and within walking distance of so many restaurants.

review.title: Not Marriott quality you expect.
review.reviewText: Overall, I cannot say that the staff did anything wrong. It just didn't feel like they did anything right. Check in was very mechanical. The whole hotel felt very old and dated. Room comfort was ok but didn't feel like we were getting the quality I expected from Marriott or value for what I was paying for. A dirty room service tray was left across the hall from us. It was there when we checked in and was still there when we checked out the next morning. There are a lot of hotel options near the Wharf. Look elsewhere and pass on this Marriott.
review.positiveRemarks: I did have a bed to sleep in for a night.

review.title: Nice hotel close to piers
review.reviewText: Hotel was well located to touring company operations, restaurants, etc. in a relatively safe area.  The homeless sleeping on the sidewalks in our area was a little disturbing, but they did not bother my wife and me.
review.negativeRemarks: Free wifi
review.locationRemarks: Bus tours, bay tours, Alcatraz tours are close by

review.title: Very Nice!!
review.reviewText: Great Location.....Staff at every level was so nice and helpful. Definitely will be back!!!

review.title: Great staff and location
review.reviewText:
Wonderful stay.  Staff could not be more accommodating and helpful.  Clean and well decorated hotel.
Will stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Do not change a thing.
review.locationRemarks: Great location for wharf area as well as city itself.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText:
Good location, close to Wharf, but far enough away to be quiet.  Excellent staff and nice accomodation's.




















e
review.negativeRemarks: Possibly have complimentary breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent, with plenty of shopping, sightseeing, and transportation access.

review.title: love the marriotts!!
review.reviewText: Enjoyed being so close to Fisherman's Wharf!  Hotel was very clean, and loved the lounge area.  We have stayed at a lot of Marriotts in the U.S., and they are all good!!
review.negativeRemarks: cant really think of anything
review.locationRemarks: loved the location!!  It was nice to be able to walk to almost everything.  We would definitely want to be close again to Fisherman's Wharf!!

review.title: Great location. Clean. Pricey.
review.reviewText: Hotel is at the western end of Fisherman's Wharf close to some of the better restaurants, Lombrad Street, and the Powell-Hyde cable car line.  Spotless but more expensive than similar hotels in the same area.

review.title: The REAL price?
review.reviewText: "Parking Available" is how it read in the write-up.  It's $54.00 per night plus $6.00 TAX.  There were TWO complimentary bottles of water in the room.  "Your credit card will be charged an ADDITIONAL $4.50 for each bottle".   This is an old OLD property that is OVER PRICED, and OVER RATED.  The hired help seemed a little defensive when quizzed about PARKING, about WHY $54.00 per night.  Their ONLY response was, "you can have access 24 hours, and come and go as you please, as many times as you like"... REALLY?  Seems I've never been denied access to my "valet parked vehicle"... EVER!!  All in, we paid about $325.00 for ONE night.  NEVER AGAIN MR. MARRIOTT.
review.negativeRemarks: initial communication about the TOTAL COST OF STAYING THERE
review.locationRemarks: this is a givin... Fishermans Warf

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is very clean, especially the rooms. The location is excellent, we walked to the the piers, we walked to the Alcatraz Landing at Pier 33 (7 blocks) and you can walk to restaurants on Columbus Ave as well. Calzone's was an excellent restaurant. Great experience. And I do not want to forget Michael, the concierge, what a great person an excellent employee. He helped us and everybody looking for help. Two thumbs up for him.

review.title: Perfect getaway to the Golden Gate
review.reviewText:
+ walking distance to the Fisherman's Wharf
+ very accommodating stafff
+ very clean hotel room
+ very nice hotel room

review.title: Great access to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Wanted secure and easy parking. The attendants made the parking work very well.  Location was excellent to use as a base for our activities.  The only disappointment was being charged for room WIFI.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, ease of parking and unloading our car, ease of getting around in the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't charge for internet.
review.locationRemarks: Beach, tourist facilities, Fisherman's Wharf, parks, Golden Gate Bridge

review.title: Very convenient location nice hotel for all ages!
review.reviewText: Very nice, clean hotel friendly staff! Things are very expensive in SF, ie parking, food etc but having a nice staff and hotel make everything worth it.
review.negativeRemarks: nice if parking was included and free breakfast like other hotels
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf, North Beach, Marina all real close.

review.title: My hotel stay
review.reviewText: I was charged for everything at this hotel, even a rollaway bed. Nowhere online did it mention that valet was mandatory and they charge $54 a night. I found this every sneaky of the hotel. During my stay I used a vending machine that only took credit cards, and a few hours later I was alerted by my credit card company that I had fraud in my account. I was very upset my whole stay

this hotel is just so so.
the biggest advantage for this hotel is it's location

review.title: Very cozy!
review.reviewText: Cozy and also bright, clean atmosphere; loved the oversized seating in the restaurant and mostly - the fruit water next to the coffee; different fruits each day.  It's the little things :]. Cleanliness and quiet all A+.

review.title: Excellent Fisherman's Warf Location
review.reviewText: Excellent accommodations close to Fisherman's Warf area as well as public transportation to greater San Francisco area.  Hotel was clean and comfortable and the staff were welcoming and helpful.  Concierge was extremely helpful.  Would highly recommend the hotel.  We did not eat at the hotel because there were so many wonderful restaurants close by.
review.negativeRemarks: Room had a bit of a deodorizing smell.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location to Fishman's Warf and public transportation.  Hollywood Café nearby had outstanding breakfast options.

review.title: Aging, pricey hotel in a good location
review.reviewText:
We stayed here for two nights in March. The hotel location is excellent, being within easy walking distance to the wharf and the cable car stops. It served as a good base for our visits.

The rooms themselves are small. While reasonably quiet, the air conditioner is outdated and and very noisy. It woke us up every time it kicked in. Parking is insanely expensive ($50 per night). This hotel is worth about half it's price and does not meet what the bar I usually expect for Marriott quality, but gets away with it due to location. 

The hotel is surrounded by other hotels, so don't be afraid to look around. This is a Marriott in name only.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel needs refreshed, including modern, quiet air conditioning
review.locationRemarks: Walked to the wharf and cable car lines. Definitely ride the Duck -- it was the highlight of the trip. Nearby restaurants suck and are overpriced.

review.title: Nice hotel conveniently located, quiet.
review.reviewText: Excellent staff, helpful, friendly.  Very clean, quiet hotel.
Great room and staff but loud traffic noise from outside
I have stayed in less expensive hotels with free wi-fi and more comfortable beds with shuttle service from airport, so I'll probably never stay at a Marriott again.

review.title: Perfect location in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
From check In to check out our three nights and days were a great experience. Staff could not have been more helpful, the fifth floor room was large and clean with a very large bathroom compared to other places we've stayed during our trip. The only niggle was that they were upgrading the TV system throughout the building during our stay and consequently there was little to no reception. Valet parking added dollars to the room cost but made things very easy.
The main advantage was the location - in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf, near the Explorer Bus Terminal and many places of interest such as Pier 39 - walking distance.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, the room and the location.
review.negativeRemarks: TV system was not working during our stay but that was temporary while the system was undergoing an upgrade.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the heart of Zfisherman's Wharf and all the tourist shops, the restaurants the attractions - such as Pier 39, the ferry to Alcatraz Island.

review.title: Nice clean hotel in great location fro good price
review.reviewText: Nice room, but looked out right at sidewalk level. Good breakfast buffet.

One night I was bitten by a nasty spider on my wrist.
Other than that, excellent.

review.title: Near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is great and the staff is outstanding. It's about 3 blocks to Fisherman's Wharf and near a bus line as well as trolley.
review.positiveRemarks: Concierge and staff are helpful and friendly. Breakfast is not included and very expensive. Trader Joe's within 3 blocks.
review.negativeRemarks: Include free breakfast in room rate!
review.locationRemarks: Lots of walking required, but 2 blocks away is bus to Ferry Building. Local bus across street (with transfer) to Presidio

review.reviewText: everything I expected. Close to wharf,clean,great staff, and nice accomodations.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Jim,
Thank you for providing feedback from your recent stay.

We are sorry that you are disappointed with the taxes. Unfortunately, two of the three tax lines, MED (Moscone Expansion District) and TID (Tourism Improvement District) are assessed by the City of San Francisco. This is in addition to the Hotel Occupancy Tax that is a state tax.

Please know that the valet parking charges in our hotel is in line with the average hotel parking charges in the city. Compared to most public parking in the area, we do provide a safe, secured valet parking with unlimited in&out privilege.

We hope you would consider our property again in the future.

Sincerley,

review.title: Close to fisherman's warf - easy in and out.
review.reviewText: The big surprise - $54 for one night parking.  With all the tax's and fee's - $23.77 room tax, $1.69 TDA fee, $2.11 Med fee, $54 parking, $7.60 Parking tax - My $169 room tuned into $271.60.  You gave me $25 off for my Expedia points or it would be almost $300.  Really????  You need to include all of these tax's and fee's in the selection of a hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: see above
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Warf

review.title: Great location

review.title: convenient upscale hotel

I was on 3rd floor street side of hotel and I did not have a problem with noise. It's a nicer, but certainly not luxury hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText: We are never disappointed when we stay at a Marriott hotel.  The staff is friendly, the decor kept up to date and the beds are super comfortable.  This hotel was located just a couple of blocks from the wharfs, shopping and the best restaurants in the country!
review.locationRemarks: The hotel was just a few blocks from everything you wanted to do in San Fransisco.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf and all the fun sights of San Fran. Coffee tables looked like they had not been cleaned... 3 water glass rings and dust... otherwise all seemed well... Street was a little loud but with it being Bay street and New Years = lots of people out and about... Parking was VERY PRICEY, but also nice to have the valet and not have to worry about car. Awesome variety of coffee/tea/fruit infused water/apple cider in lobby over course of stay - nice touch
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness upon check-in, price of parking

managementResponses.response:
Hello,

Thank you for taking the time to write a review about our hotel. At Marriott we strive to exceed guest expectations and clearly this time we did not meet yours. We apologize for any inconvenience you experienced. I can assure you that we can do better.

Our parking service come with valet and in and out privileges while the other parking garages don't. Out rates are comparable, if not less expensive, than other hotels in the area and in the city.

Thank you for noting that our valet attendant was very friendly and that the room was clean. We pride ourselves on providing the best service to our guests.

If you'd like to discuss your hotel experience further, please feel free to contact us directly.

review.title: Over priced for what you get in return
review.reviewText:
I stay in San Francisco every 3 weeks for business.  This is the first time I have chosen this specific hotel.
The reason I did so, was that I was saving a "few bucks".  Because it's for business, I try to keep our companies costs down when booking.
When I got to the hotel and pulled in to park.  I was greeted by a very friendly attendant.  That was wonderful.
Then he told me it's $50 a night to park!!!  I have never had such an inflated rate and have stayed much closer to the wharf, actually right on it, in the past for less.  With the ourtrageous parking, I actually cost my company more money than had I stayed at another location.
I attempted to negotiate at the desk and was told that housing and property is worth more in San Francisco, so it is what it is and they couldn't reduce it.
My room was facing a noisey back street with the cable line running directly next to the window.  This allowed for noise continually.  The drapes wouldn't completely shut, leading to a street lamp shining through the gap all night.
The room was smaller than what I'm used to at a Marriot.  Although it was clean.  
Overall I would say my stay was mediocre and I will not be back.

review.title: No wifi?!!
review.reviewText: The hotel was situated in a fantastic walking position however I wouldn't stay again as the rooms were very noisy and there was no in room wifi unless you wanted a daily fee per device

review.title: Good fisherman's wharf and cable car hotel
review.reviewText:
Very clean and very close to wharf,  trolly/cable cars and pier 39.  Close to bicycle rentals and moderate ride to bridge almost exclusively by bike path. Room was affordable, breakfast was pricy and wifi in the room was pay (and expensive. Lobby was free)

Room air handler was a bit loud but this is truly the extend of the negatives.  Positive experience.  If your trip to sf is water (including marina district) and bridge centric,  this is great choice.  A cable car ride past lombard street on the way to unión square is easy, as is a street car from the wharf along the water to the ballpark.

review.title: Convenient, freindl, helpful

review.title: NO Communication!!!!
review.reviewText:
I booked a birthday weekend in San Francisco with my sister & her husband.  3 people in one room, and I specifically requested 2 beds.  We get to the hotel by 3pm only to be told that they don't have any rooms with 2 beds.  Are you kidding me?!!!!  And you couldn't have called us to tell us?  Unbelievable!   They blamed Expedia for the inconvenience. 

Thanks for the ridiculous roll away bed and very inconvenient, and awkward situation having to share a bed with my sister on my birthday!   $400 for one night and all you compensate us with is free parking and $1 coupons for chocolate.  Thanks a lot jerks!!!  Good for nothing!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review.positiveRemarks: They tried to "comp" us for the inconvenience.  Thanks for the $1 coupons that will really make up for your horrible shortcomings.
review.negativeRemarks: How about COMMUNICATING that your hotel is insufficient to accommodate your guests BEFORE they check in so they can make other plans?!!

I did not sleep well. My son heard it also.

There was a sticky glass ring on the night stand when we checked in.

review.locationRemarks: The location of the hotel is very good. It is level to walk around to the many attractions in Fisherman's Wharf area.

review.negativeRemarks: The rooms need improvement. New carpeting would help.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman Wharf. Great location

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText: We booked here last minute for 3 nights, hotel was fine only issue was that the wifi was only free in the lobby!!!!

review.title: Not for my next trip
review.reviewText: Nothing good except for the location, which is close to the Fisherman's Wharf
review.locationRemarks: Close to the Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39

review.title: Close enough to everything
review.reviewText:
We traveled with a teenager daughter & a 9 yr old son, as well with in-laws & the stay was fantastic.
Rooms are big enough to sleep & rest. The only drawn back is that they don't offer bigger beds in rooms with double beds. I wish they could offer queen beds on rooms with double beds it's more comfortable! other then that the hotel was good. Staff was friendly & helpful !!!
review.negativeRemarks: Bigger beds in rooms with double beds. Free water bottle!!
review.locationRemarks: Alcatraz landing about 10-15 min walking, Golden gate bridge close enough to drive. Fisherman wharf pier walking distance.

review.title: Easy walk to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: We booked the hotel while driving into town, vaguely knowing the location. We were pleasantly surprised by the quality of our room and the amenities, and by the excellent staff. From the valets to the bellboy, the check-in and cleaning staff, they were all friendly and helpful. This is at a very busy tourist area where staff often get burned out. The restaurant and bar were a disappointment but with so many great places within an easy walk, not a problem. The parking is expensive.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed, the staff and the location.
review.locationRemarks: You are two blocks from the F-Line streetcar, which connects you with the whole city. The cable car is a 2 minute walk.

review.title: Hotel well situated near fishermans wharf
review.reviewText:
The staff were all very helpful. Food from the resturant was great.
Laundry was good and free.
review.negativeRemarks: Pillows very small and lumpy. We also booked a taxi for Oakland airport and the staff told the taxi driver san fransisco airport so it cost $150.
review.locationRemarks: Near to fishermans wharf, alcatraz pier.

review.title: Great hotel near the Bay
review.reviewText: As soon as we arrived the staff greeted us with smiles. The hotel was very clean and in a prime location to activities and restaurants. Highly recommend!

review.positiveRemarks: The staff is extremely curteous and attentive to all their guests.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is centrally located, walkable to many sights including Fishermans Wharf, North Beach, Chinatown and the cable car to name a few.

review.reviewText:
The hotel itself was rather old. There was garbage (old cups and paper) stuck in the bushes and around
the curbs. I understand it is in a major city but I would expect that around the city, not in the hotel area.
Cigarette buts on the ground, for the price the Marriott should hire someone to sweep up. I have stayed @ other
Marriott's and this one was not up to their standards.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. It was right where we wanted to be
review.negativeRemarks: Update the facility and keep up on the house keeping
review.locationRemarks: Location was fine, right in the Warf area. Lots of things to do. Plenty of shops and a ton of food options

review.reviewText: It's a nice place but a little overpriced.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking should be included.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. Only complaint is that it was very loud at night, both street noise and other guests. Stayed for 2 nights and each night other guests were extremely loud in their rooms and hallway, one couple having a race down hallway at 2 am and there didnt seem to be any staff trying to manage these guests.

review.title: I will.definitely come.back here...
review.reviewText: its an awesome.experience...I love the cleanliness and the staff was so professional..

review.title: Room not worth the money
review.reviewText:
Great location, poor room fro the price, very noisy, shower was too short, my wife complained and she is 5ft.
TV not HD. Don't get room 595 at this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Very close the Wharf.

review.title: Ok hotel.
review.reviewText: The room was decent. Stay in an interior room meaning face the courtyard. The outside traffic can be noisy. This 4 story hotel is ok if u must stay by the warf. Didnt look like there was any better options. No 5 star hotels down there. Took shuttle from airport for $17 each. No need for car. Hotel staff was friendly and accommodating to my many requests. Ill choose to stay in unions square next visit so I have better choices In hotels

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Was good. Good room. Good staff. A pleasant place where to sleep but no more...

review.title: Great hotel right in the Wharf
review.reviewText: Moved to it from the amazingly bad Wharf Inn. That may have increased my appreciation of the Marriott. Wonderfully pleasant and helpful staff, fantastic location and quiet clean comfortable room - what more can one ask for?
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, location, cleanliness, quiet, comfort were outstanding.
review.negativeRemarks: The parking is valet only and rather expensive, a lower rate would be an improvement. On the other hand, you don't really need a car there.
review.locationRemarks: It sits right smack in the middle of the tourist trap that the Fisherman's Wharf is.. Easy access to everything, Cable Car terminus right there.

review.title: Nice hotel but too expensive.
review.reviewText: A lot of hotels double their room rate on the weekend in San Francisco. This room was comfortable but really not much better than a motel room and it cost $415.00 for one night. If you can't get to San Francisco on a weekday, I'd say skip the high price and get something further away from Fisherman's Wharf for a lot cheaper. You can take a lot of taxi rides for that kind of money.
review.negativeRemarks: Price. Bed.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf.

review.title: Rate your Hotel.
review.reviewText: The room was nice but the curtains on the windows , as we were opening it ripped in our hand and were very dusty.
review.positiveRemarks: it was quite and the staff were very helpful
review.negativeRemarks: update the curtains.
review.locationRemarks: We went to Alcartraz, to Golden State Bridge, Little Italy, China town, Mass at Sts. Peter and Paul Catholic Church, and many more sights.

review.title: GREAT LOCAL
review.reviewText: GREAT, FUN PLACE TO STAY. tHATS ALL I HAVE TO SAY.
review.negativeRemarks: NO
review.locationRemarks: WHARF, RESTURANTS, CABLE CAR, ETC

review.title: Close to Fisherman's wharf but waaay overpriced
review.reviewText: Booked a room last minute on expedia for 4 people but hotel only had rooms with a king bed available when we arrived. Said they would bring up a rollaway bed and more towels when we checked in. Had to call back for the roll away and towels never came. $50 for parking?? $25 for bare bones breakfast buffet?
review.positiveRemarks: Good location. Close enough to walk to the wharf, Giardelli's, cable car and North Beach.
review.negativeRemarks: How about drop the rates or improve the product to match the cost.

review.title: Good Place to stay at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We had a pleasant 6 nights at the hotel. The room was clean, neat and comfortable. I would suggest staying on one of the upper floors to get a better view. Our view was straight into a tree outside of the window. We were within walking distance of most of the things if interest in Fisherman's Wharf. A trolley stop was a couple of blocks away that we used to get to downtown SF and Union Square. It was cold riding the open top tour buses around the bay area, so a jacket or hoodie is needed.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was excellent. Very professional, friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: The only negatives concerning the hotel was the cost of parking and wireless internet services.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is a few blocks off the water near Pier 39, Golden Gate & Bay Bridges. Many tours, dining, shopping & rental cars within walking distance.

review.title: Great place to stay for seeing San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Fisherman's Wharf area is perfect jumping off place to see San Francisco. Mass transit, bikes, and tours,will get you to anywhere in the city as well as the Golden Gate Bridge and Sausalito. Decent restaurants on the Wharf and Hollywood Cafe is a must for breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel concierge and staff are very helpful in planning your day or evening with good tips for how to get around and places to eat.
review.negativeRemarks: Would have given the hotel a 5 rating if not for the noise transmission between rooms which only mattered in the morning if you slept a little late.
review.locationRemarks: Tours of Alcatraz, Golden Gate Bridge (drive or bike), Knob Hill, Haight, Mission, and North Beach neighborhoods are easy to get to from there.

review.title: Excellent stay
review.reviewText: We booked the room on Expedia for 3 adults. When we arrived at the hotel we had one king sized bed. We thankfully were able to exchange for another room. That was the only difficulty we experienced.

review.title: Gouge The Tourists
review.reviewText: I just left from a three day stay at the hotel. From the moment I checked in I had a feeling the customer service would struggle. Woman checking me in? Rude. Women on the phone when I called down with a question? Rude. Bartender in the bar? Rude. I won't even get into the fact that I paid 350 a night and they nickle and dimed me for everything. Wireless in the room? $$$. Use the "Business Center" to buy Giants tickets? $$$. Now if you don't mind being raked over the coals for things other hotels don't charge for (nicer hotels), then go for it. Otherwise, skip it and stay outside the Wharf where hotel managers understand customer service. It's San Francisco, you have choices. Stay elsewhere.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was comfortable and clean. No issues there.
review.negativeRemarks: Erase the staff. Start over. Give up charging me $3 to be online for five minutes and print two black and white pages. Really?
review.locationRemarks: The wharf speaks for itself.

review.title: Run
review.reviewText: I wouldn't book that place if it was the last place on Earth. Dirty, rundown, noisy..... and the re$traunt.......what were they thinking????
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast should not cost $30 for one person. Small beds. Dirty hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel, convenient to Wharf, Lombard Hill, etc
review.reviewText: Very convenient location to the Wharf, Lombard Hill, Street/cable cars, etc. Staff was very friendly and professional. Room was clean and bed/pillows were comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: The only addition I'd request is additional towel racks in the bathroom to allow guests to be "green" and re-use bath linens by giving them a place to
review.locationRemarks: Anything in and around the Wharf. What's not nearby can be accessed by using the street/cable cars located just a couple of blocks away.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is very close to Fisherman's Wharf, the Cable cars, and the ferry's to Alcatraz. It doesn't have all the amenities of a full service Marriott, but the staff makes up for it with free drinks at the bar, free breakfast, and concierge service. The only thing I didn't like is the mandatory valet service at $50/night, which is absurd but it the norm all through San Francisco so it isn't this particular hotel's fault.
review.negativeRemarks: Lower the price on overnight valet service. My rental car cost me $148 for 4 days. The hotel charged me $150 to park it. I got the car for NAPA.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, cable cars, ferries, Ghiardelli Square .

review.title: Terrible beds
review.reviewText: 4* hotel with 1* bedding. The beds belongs to motel 6 maybe (and that is even an insult to motel 6), it squirt every time I move. It should be a MOTEL instead. Will never stay there again.

review.title: Don't bring a car
review.reviewText: No complaints about the hotel, only stayed one night. Parking was $57.

review.title: Our First time in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We were told to that the place to be in San Francisco was Fisherman's Wharf and that's right. As a family with two boys the Marriott at Fisherman's Wharf had everything we needed for a wonderful stay. Like any other hotel, some people may find some things nicer than another and there is always room of opportunity, but I will not complain about the little things because overall it provided all that we needed: a nice clean place to stay, safe and close to the Wharf and everything around it, attention and quick response, and family friendly environment. Had we wanted luxury, we would have stayed at a hotel 300 dlls away. The Marriott at Fisherman's Wharf performed and delivered nicely.
review.positiveRemarks: Closeness to all the attractions by the bay.
review.negativeRemarks: A little bit of bling or sense of upscale.
review.locationRemarks: Eat, and eat great seafood. Tours to Alcatraz, walk to Ghirardelli Square, Pier 39, the seals, the view of the sea in the afternoons, everything!

review.title: Cultural Fit Experience
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a superb location in Fisherman's Wharf. The Marriott had extremely kind employees who addressed all our needs and concerns in a timely manner. We appreciated their efforts in directing us to all the major attraction sites. The concierge was quite knowledgeable. The workout facilities were great and provided water, washing/drying machines, fresh fruits and ear phones. We felt bad for the room right next to it (room #285) since the door always seem to shut loudly. The rooms were average and did show some wear. It could've been cleaned more thoroughly but was fine. I strongly recommend arranging for a taxi pick up so you can receive a flat rate. From SFO to the hotel cost near $65 with tip. On the return trip we arranged an airport shuttle with Quake for $11/person. There is a Walgreens a block away for water and other needed items. Bring your gym shoes!! As your feet can get you nearly everywhere but there are buses and cable car rides close by. People are extremely friendly so if in doubt just ask a local.
review.positiveRemarks: The service and workout facilities were definitely a plus!!
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms could've been cleaner.
review.locationRemarks: Close to many restaurants. Check out Codmother's, Boudin, Pier 39, Alcatraz, Coit Tower, Lombard's crooked street, Union Square and Chinatown.

review.title: Great location in a a safe tourist area
review.reviewText: Very clean hotel, right done the street from fisherman a wharf and cable cars. Housekeeping did a great job cleaning our rooms when we were out exploring the city. Disappointed that they did not give free wifi and the restaurant was very expensive. Parking was also expensive.

review.title: Excelent experience
review.reviewText: very confortable, everything OK. Seems to be recycled, cleanliness excelent
review.locationRemarks: excelent

review.title: Good Room, annoying charges
review.reviewText: Room and location was great. Outside of the hotel looked a little run down. 50 dollar parking and 12.95 internet was annoying.
review.negativeRemarks: 50 dollar parking
review.locationRemarks: Close to the Wharf

review.title: Hotel to get close to wharf
review.reviewText:
Fantastic front desk! Room clean. Bit noisy from traffic but its big city.
Close to walk to wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise from traffic

review.title: Think Twice about Marriott at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
Hotel is in a fine location. Hotel ammenities for a Marriott are deadfull. NO Roomservice! You can get Breakfast, but that's it. It will be delivered to your room. No dinning room except for dinner.

Wi-Fi is expensive. It should be free for what you are paying for the room.The room was the size of a small dog gage. My dogs get more space when I board them.

The bedding smelled of sweat. Not cool. They could clean better.

The Hotel staff were very pleasant, but since there was nothing for them to do, I would be happy too!

I generaly stay at the Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf. It's very good. I would go there. The price difference is not that different.
I will not go back to the Marriott.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location. If you fly in to San Francisco the location is fine. I always fly so I don't know what they charge for parking..
review.negativeRemarks: Most every thing.
review.locationRemarks: Only place to eat at Fisherman's Wharf is Scomas. All the other restruarnats are tourist traps. I've been to the Wharf many times over the years.

review.title: Clean!
review.reviewText: The hotel was pretty clean and the location was pretty decent. I wish they had a pool though. It was pricey but consider the location, it might be reasonable. Plus, I was late for check out but they were nice about it. I'd recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great Base
review.reviewText: What a great base camp I would love to return soon :)
review.negativeRemarks: Air Con was noisy but not a major issue. We thought the bottled room water we free as it was-not in the mini bar etc, not a major problem :(
review.locationRemarks: Great area

review.title: San Francisco Stay
review.reviewText: Would had preferred that the room had two chairs rather than 1.

review.title: Great location and good price with parking
review.reviewText: All very good. Parking and location worked out great. Clean and comfortable. Bath a bit small, only big enough for one, but sufficient. Concierge recommended a terrible restaurant. That was our only dissappointment.

review.title: The only good thing is the location
review.reviewText: I will start this out by saying that my husband and I have traveled a lot and have stayed in a lot of places and only one other time did I write a bad review. This is the second time we have been to San Francisco and I can truly say I never need to go back. The hotels are way over priced and not really well maintained. The beds need to be removed and burned they smell. The pillows smell like greasy hair from other people. The bathroom is way too small for the size of the room. If you sat on the pot your knees could almost touch the door. I would rather have a bigger bathroom than a seating area that I would never sit in, because they sofa is so old and fadded and dirty looking. Last but not least the 50.00 per night extra for parking your car! The best part is they also charge you tax on that 50.00. Oh wait the other best part was when we went to go get our car from valet the young man told my husband to get it himself because he did not want to burn out the clutch! REALLY! and we should tip you for this?! Overall two high rated hotels The Marriot and the Hyatt can count us out from now on. If we wanted to sleep in a dump we would gladly do it and pay a lot less and know what we were getting.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything else
review.locationRemarks: Location is a short distance from the wharf

review.title: Staff is the friendliest I've ever encountered.
review.reviewText: This is an excellent hotel if you're looking to stay around Fisherman's Wharf -- only two blocks away. The staff was extremely friendly and did everything to make sure we enjoyed our stay. I will be staying here on any future trips to the Bay Area.

review.title: Great Location for the Wharf
review.reviewText: Nice Location for the Wharf. Clean Hotel with Great Staff. Extra Towels, Crib for our child were brought to our room immediately. Free Parking offered with our room package. Great vallet service had our car ready to go and also gave great directions. Bellman helped with our bags which was appreciated with two children. Breakfast at Hotel was great and kids were free, Crayons for the kids was nice. I came down one morning asking for silverware sp we could feed the kids cereal in the room. Staff made me a free coffee and got me what I needed. Maids cleaned our room and restocked towels multiple times a day. Nice

review.title: San Francisco Weekend Getaway
review.reviewText: Staff was friendly and very helpful. Location was good as it was within walking distance of the Wharf.

review.title: Poor concierge
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, except for the significant street noise and Jon, the concierge who was completely unhelpful and provided bad information. All other staff were fantastic.
review.negativeRemarks: Street noise in the room. Windows need to be double glazed
review.locationRemarks: Great, but there are many others in the are to chose from

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: It is not better than Marriott in union square, but the hotel is nice as well.

review.title: Not the Best Marriott
review.reviewText: Good things: Very courteous staff, nice bar, pretty good food, nice to have coffee maker in room. Not so good things: Our room was on the street side, so it was a bit noisy. We could also hear things like when people were talking loudly in the hallway and toilets flushing in other rooms; just not as restful/quiet as I'd like. Water pressure in the bathroom was weak. Wasn't really anywhere to relax outside.
review.negativeRemarks: Low water pressure, no outside sitting area
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location, easy walk to the wharf as well as tours and cable cars

review.title: Good Location to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Good value, convenient location and helpful staff? No further comments to make.
review.positiveRemarks: Close proximity to Fishermans Wharf and facitlities
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant was not very inspiring. However this was mitigated but the fact that there were many excellent restaurants nearby.
review.locationRemarks: See answer to favorite aspect above

review.title: Nice at a great location
review.reviewText: It was great to walk a few blocks and be close to lots of tourist places.

review.title: would stay here again
review.reviewText: enjoyed my stay. Staff was good, room was very nice especially since the outside of the building is pretty plain, close to wharf and was quiet.
review.positiveRemarks: room decor was nice, updated with nice finishings, bed and linens were nice, rate was good considering it was at the wharf
review.locationRemarks: location was great

review.title: Wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: Wonderful experience. Would return here for sure. The staff is outstanding.
review.negativeRemarks: Fee for parking
review.locationRemarks: Withing walking distance to everything

review.title: Close to Fisherman's Warf
review.reviewText: This hotel is only two blocks from Fisherman's Warf and is in a good location. The rooms were clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. Beds were comfortable. I wish there was more info in the room about what the hotel offers and what is close by. I don't like that internet costs extra - but we were able to use our cell phone. I was satisfied with the room even though I did expect a little more since it was the Marriott - but really nothing to complain about.
review.negativeRemarks: It was boring.

review.title: Good for business, great location
review.reviewText: I would recommend only if you are on business visit. Location is great, however it is way too pricey for what it offers. Especially disappointing is that internet is not included in the rate

review.title: Great for parking, food and sleep.
review.reviewText: Booked on Expedia, came in really late from airport. Son and daughter in law were able to check into motel without a problem. I told Expedia that my son would be checking in and it all went terrific without any problems. Everyone was so nice!
review.positiveRemarks: Great buffet breakfast and fabulous service.
review.negativeRemarks: Not enough cups in room.

review.title: Not up to Marriott expectations!
review.reviewText:
This Marriott doesn't meet the expectations set by other Marriotts. It is an older hotel though has been renovated inside. The staff at the front desk is a little rude, especially when you complain about something. We used their kid's On Demand feature on the TV. The menu said the show cost $0.00. When we got the bill it showed a charge of $9.99. I would not have let my kids order it if it showed $9.99. I told the font desk and the lady told me it does say $0.00 on the screen but -I- should have known it would cost money. Really? Eventually she refunded the charge but not before telling me several times it was my fault.

When we got in the room we went to take a shower. There were several hairs in the shower! They weren't from us. This is just not something I expect in any priced hotel.

The buffet was also disappointing. Much of the "hot" food was cold. The scrambled eggs were not even fully cooked so my kids wouldn't eat them. The hostess assured us my son could get a waffle at the buffet but there was no waffle maker and no staff to help. After waiting for quite a while we gave up on the waffle. So I paid $15 for my son to have toast and a piece of toast which he said tasted stale.

The only good thing is the location. It is only two blocks from the wharf. Great location! But there were 3 other hotels on the same corner. Next time we'll try one of those.

We've stayed at the Marriott in Union Square and it is MUCH better but we wanted to be near the wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: Rudeness of staff, rooms not cleaned, buffet.

review.title: Location, Location, Location
review.reviewText: The room was adequate, service was good, and the concerege was very helpful. The location was great-2 blocks from embarkedero. The only drawback was paying $54.75/night to park rental car from airport, at the hotel. (There was an AVIS a block away we could have rented to go to the wine country)
review.negativeRemarks: $54.75/night for parking

review.title: Comfortable and close
review.reviewText: Very nice staff, helpful and pleasant. Two blocks walk to the embarcadero. Far enough away to be quiet at night Safe area, well lit and people around.
review.locationRemarks: Not to hard to get to, ESP considering SF traffic and one way streets

review.title: Sad in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Excellent staff. All of them.

Dislikes: noisy rooms, no sound protection. You're able to clearly hear every one in the hallways.

Air/heat noisy. Difficult to sleep. Hums or roars. Room 360
review.negativeRemarks: Air, heating noise.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent !!!!!

review.title: Comfortable Stay in San Fran!
review.reviewText: Excellent location with good access to public transportation. Friendly staff.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Good hotel; no free Internet in room was a disappointment;

review.title: Great location, no pool/hot tub, pay for wifi
review.reviewText:
I assumed they'd have a pool and/or hot tub, but they did not. After a long flight I was looking forward to a hot tub. So I was disappointed. The other thing was paying an additional $12-$14 (can't remember exactly) for wifi ? For the rate of the room I'd say they could at least include this... so that was a turn off.

The place was very nice though, great staff and very helpful. Close tot he wharf and lots of great stuff to do, see, eat.
review.negativeRemarks: paying for wifi and no pool or hot tub
review.locationRemarks: a couple blocks from the wharf and everything you could want

review.title: Nice hotel for a weekend
review.reviewText: Great location. Very nice hotel. The price was good but the parking price was expensive.

review.title: Fantastic hotel, more than friendly staff
review.reviewText: Absolutely fantastic. Wouldnt really be able to find a fault without really looking, so those little things wouldnt matter. Location is great, just a five minute walk to fishermans warf and some great restaurants. Also only a few minutes walk to the bus stop for the hop on hop off bus tour.

review.title: Great bargain, great location.
review.reviewText: I booked this room thinking it was the same hotel I had stayed in two years ago on another trip to SF. It wasn't until I arrived in the lobby that I realized I has stayed two blocks away. I was sad because the last place was great. Well, this hotel was even better!! The staff was friendly, upbeat and helpful without being annoying. The room was super clean and the lobby was comfortable and spacious. My only reason or giving this overall review a 4.5 instead of a 5 is because there wasn't a mini fridge. I like to keep water and juices cold and this wasn't possible here. He location is fabulous or walking to the Embarcadero, the wharf, North Beach and more. I will definitely book my next stay in SF here.

review.title: Great Place to Stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great stay! Centrally located, close to the Wharf and Ghirardelli Square. Public transportation (trolleys & buses) were easily accessible to take you to all San Francisco has to offer!! Friendly, very accommodating personnel.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: This hotel was located right next to restaurants and a drug store. You can walk to eat or grab a bottle of water at the drug store in 3 mins. Entering a hotel was time consuming due to limited drop off space and only way to park is thru valet service. Hotel looked old, but overall maintained quite surroundings. You can park here even if you are checked out and walk over to Fisherman's wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: Room is a small...no free internet...
review.locationRemarks: OK

review.title: Very nice hotel!!
review.reviewText: This hotel service is too comfortable for the room fee. And all staffs are very friendly. And also the hotel location is very convenient for tourist because it's very close many restaurants of fisherman's wharf and also cable car stations.
review.negativeRemarks: Building is little bit old. But not so concerned.
review.locationRemarks: It's perfect. cable car stations are very close. And many restaurants are also close.

review.title: Hotel in a great area
review.reviewText: Hotel cleanliness was up to standards. Rooms were updated and comfortable. However, a staff member ran over my luggage and almost a month later, staff has not contacted me regarding my complaint. Had staff made a better attempt for this, I would have rated it a 5, too bad...
review.negativeRemarks: Staffs concern for customer
review.locationRemarks: Close to Wharf, walking distance to many places.

review.title: Kiwi in San Fran
review.reviewText: Staff pleasant and helpful. Location great nice and close to the key sights.fisherman's wharf etc

review.title: Awful Hotel
review.reviewText: When we first got their we ate dinner in the restaurant and the waiter argued with us when the order was not what we expected with outrageous prices. Found a hair in the bed with with pillows that smelled like they never been washed from the last person. Water cost 3.80 a bottle. The hotel in general looked nasty and run-down. Everyone was nice except one person on checkout and she argue with us about letting us borrow a luggage carrier.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco at Fisherman's wharf

review.title: Great wharf location
review.reviewText: Great location. Easy walking distance to either of two trolley points - easy to get to Union Square or Chinatown. All of wharf area within walking distance. Hop On/Hop Off tour buses only a few blocks away. Hotel area reasonably quiet. Staff persons were all very friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: In room coffee; proximity to trolley, pubs, and wharf restaurants; staffs' greetings at our return each day.
review.negativeRemarks: No view to speak off
review.locationRemarks: Easy walking distance to trolley, several irish pubs, wharf area and Pier 39.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: We love the location of this hotel. Very near to Pier 39, and other attractions at Fisherman" Wharf which makes it possible to walk to all of these.
