review.negativeRemarks: the pillows on the beds were too soft and flat!
review.locationRemarks: Great!!

review.title: Great Hotel for Anyone
review.reviewText: It was all around great, even though the power went off extensively in the whole area.

review.title: Great location, clean and modern.
review.reviewText: Very clean, modern and new feel. Easy walk to many great tourist attractions.
review.negativeRemarks: No pool for kids.
review.locationRemarks: Great location easy walk to many tourist attractions

review.title: Good enough, but noisy
review.reviewText: Nice enough hotel. VERY thin walls. Could hear everything above and to either side. Courteous, helpful staff

review.title: Great. Location
review.reviewText: Close to cable car on Hyde St, Ghiradelli square and fisherman wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Great Hotel for Holiday weekend
review.reviewText:
Our room was ready when we arrived, clean and comfortable. The hotel staff were all friendly and provided excellent service. Breakfast buffet is very good and worth a visit. Newspaper was provided free of charge.

Very good experience. I would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Well located, clean and comfortable. Staff friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: San Francisco is very "green" meaning low water pressure, towels not fully dry and requests to reuse towels to save water.
review.locationRemarks: Two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf/ easy walk to North Beach

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff and very well and up kept hotel. Nice bar inside and very close to the wharf!
review.locationRemarks: Walkin distance to fishermans wharf

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a convenient location.Walking distance to Fisherman's Warf.

review.title: Fine for the price - rooms with no view
review.reviewText: This is a solid middle-of-the-road hotel. I stayed for just one night. The room service, I will say, was excellent - not gourmet but the burger was juicy and the fries were hot and the staff very professional. The only down side was I had reserved a King and got two doubles - no big deal but it's the kind of thing to be aware of. The room was pretty clean, the bathtub was fine and the staff at the door quite helpful. It's not a luxury experience, but it's definitely just fine. Don't expect any view from the rooms though!
review.positiveRemarks: Consistently good service, esp. room service
review.negativeRemarks: The amenities are pretty basic
review.locationRemarks: Great touristy location but not the hotel with the view...you need to walk

review.title: Great location to stay if you are touring the Warf
review.reviewText: From the time we walked in until the time we left, the staff was so friendly and accommodating. The hotel is 3 blocks from Fisherman's Warf a very easy walk and convient for all shops, restaurants. Easy to catch Cable Cars, Bike Rentals, and tours. The city has construction going on everywhere and in fact, right in front of the hotel. However, our room was on the other end of the hotel and we never heard a sound. Very quiet, comfortable bed, and very nice room. I would stay here again and again and again!

review.title: Fun for Friends!
review.reviewText: Customer service was amazing, nothing standout otherwise. I recommend getting a parking package when you reserve, otherwise you have to pay ~$50 for parking underground. The valet service is awesome. If you are looking for a no-nonsense hotel in the middle of the Wharf in SF, I have nothing but lovely things to say about the Marriott Fisherman's Wharf!
review.locationRemarks: Awesome location, great parking.

review.title: Parking Solved
review.reviewText: Valet staff were very helpful. We had an van that was too tall for garage but staff parked it at entrance which was terrific.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: Terrific close to Fishermans Wharf. We bicycled over Golden Gate from here with no problem.

review.title: A Place To Sleep!
review.reviewText:
Close to Fishermans Wharf.
Good breakfast.
Other meals & drinks - go down the street!
Overall - good central location.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to Fishermans Wharf, tolley, cable car.
review.negativeRemarks: The resteraunt!
review.locationRemarks:
3 blocks from Fishermans Wharf, 2 blocks from Wallgreens and bus.
4 blocks from Scoma (great food) , 6 blocks from cable car turnaround.

review.title: The worst
review.reviewText: We did not realize this is a pet frendily non smoking hotel. The room was very small with few admenities, no fluffy robes, limited view, and smelling like a dirty dog! For the price it should have cut flowers in the rooms, or at least some sort of furnishings to help the visitors comfort. The beds are old and they tryed to cover the fact they need replacing by sticking a feather bed on the mattress, queen size bed with a full size feather bed, doesn't work. The fitted bottom sheet had no elastic left in it to hold the sheet in place, so when my husband moved it would pull the bottom sheet and feather bed, not comfortable!
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Not on Fisherman's Wharf, no view of the city.

review.title: Very pleasant stay.
review.reviewText: Its an expensive hotel so it should be nice, right? It was very nice, great location and everything felt super clean! Only thing that would have made it better would have been more water pressure for the shower.
review.negativeRemarks: Water pressure in shower on 4th floor was not good.
review.locationRemarks: Great location to Pier 39

review.title: Double Check your request
review.reviewText: Booked 3 weeks in advanced and requested double beds. Upon arrival at 3pm, they had no double beds and charged full rate to sleep on a rollaway. Lovely hotel, poor customer service.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the wharph and to transportation to union square

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText:
It was nice
Great location-can walk everywhere
room with 2 doubles beds was a little tight
review.negativeRemarks:
small room for 4 people
small bathroom
dd not have the rooom we requested when we arrived-they comped us another room
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.title: Ok but nothing else
review.reviewText: The Hotel was ok not outstanding for this price! The cost for the valet parking (48$) is outstanding!

review.title: SF Visit
review.reviewText: Location is great for SF access highly enjoyable. Staff friendly and helpful.

review.title: Review of Marriott-Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel. They had very helpful staff and went out of their way to make sure we had what we needed for a great trip. The restaurant recommendations from the concierge were outstanding. The hotel has a great gym and even has free washer/dryer services, in case you need to catch-up on some laundry while you are on the road. My one complaint is that they still charge for internet service and it exceeded $10/night. That is old school as many hotels now offer that as part of their services. Otherwise, it was a great place..
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience to Fisherman's Wharf and Ghiardelli Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Charging for internet access

review.title: Close to Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText:
Perfect location. Walking distance to everything. Very quiet.

Had to pay for internet service, should be included in stay. Concierge was not as helpful as we would have liked. Did not really offer any suggestions even though we said it was our first visit to S.F.

Overall we would stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevator doors did not look clean.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to all the piers, Ghirardelli and Boudin sourdough bread bakery mmm amazing.

review.title: Nice but Overpriced
review.reviewText: Nice hotel and staff. Just overpriced for what you get

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: for the cost of the rooms and cost of parking, I thought there should of been at least some sort of a continental breakfast that didn't cost you. There was nothing unless you wanted to pay, and pay , and pay. Understand SanFrancisco is spendy anyhow, but that little bit would of been nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to all the excitement of the city
review.negativeRemarks: No Free Continental Breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient to everything!!!

review.title: SF Marriott
review.reviewText:
Staff is helpful if you have any questions about anything.
I would stay there again.
Surprisingly there is an airport shuttle! It was only $16, great price.
review.negativeRemarks: The only downfall was room service breakfast. The English muffin was barely toasted & my breakfast was not very hot. I didn't contact room service.
review.locationRemarks: Pretty close to the main attractions on the Embarcadero

review.title: Marriott at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We stayed 4 nights and it was the most comfortable we have ever been in a hotel. The staff were all so helpful. The breakfast was great! This hotel is in walking distance of all Fisherman's Wharf has to offer. We loved San Francisco and plan on visiting again. We will definitely stay at this hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: It was quite and the elevators were very quick. Free parking
review.negativeRemarks: WiFi was not included. $12.95 for 24 hours
review.locationRemarks: The location was perfect. Walked almost everywhere we wanted to go.

review.title: 75th anniversary of Golden Gate Bridge
review.reviewText: Great location. Walking distance to all attractions on Fishermans Warf and the marina bay. Friendly staff and great concierge who came up with recommendations for restaurants that where spot on. Room very quiet (2nd level, courtyard) and very confortable beds. Bathroom was (very) small. Breakfast buffet was good, not excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: small bathroom
review.locationRemarks: excellent

review.title: Convenient Location - esp for first time visitors
review.reviewText:
The hotel room was a bit small for our family of four but it was clean and beds were comfortable. The best thing was it's proximity to the Wharf, Chinatown and North Beach plus Ghiradelli Square - all an easy walk so no need to rent car. The people who worked there were very nice, helpful and friendly. There was a Walgreen right up the street so that was convenient. We paid for the breakfast buffet (2 adult, 1 kid free) and there was definitely a good selection of warm and cold items. But at $24.95 per person for the buffet.and with so many restaurant options a walk away, I would probably skip and go to local restaurant for cooked to order breakfast and/or just grab a pastry on the street.

I would probably not stay here again because there are so many options/neighborhoods to explore that I'd want to try somewhere new next visit. HOWEVER ... if first time visit to San Francisco, it really is a great choice as it's close to all the popular tourist areas that you'll want to hit and very convenient to public transit. San Francisco is great place to explore!

review.title: MARRIOTT FISHERMAN WARF
review.reviewText: HOTEL WAS VERY NICE, STAFF VERY HELPFUL AND PLEASENT

review.title: A god hotel
review.reviewText:
I stayed for two nights and I was really pleased
with the accommodations quality for the price
review.negativeRemarks: Internet access is not included in room price
review.locationRemarks: Good location near Fisherman's Wiharf

review.title: Great experience!
review.reviewText: Great staff, great service. They even helped us hail a cab. Great experience. Also a great location for tourists, since it's not as crowded as what the Pier locations are.

review.title: Okay if money's no object
review.reviewText: Nice hotel but way over priced... just like the rest of them in the area. Stayed only one night. Went about two miles away and stayed another two for less than half the price.
review.negativeRemarks: Cost, people too busy catering to groups rather than individuals
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a good location if you don't have a car. We were able to easily walk around Fishermans Wharf and all tours collect from numerous points close by. The room was very clean and neat and the staff were friendly and helpful. I was a bit annoyed you could only use internet in the lobby and not in the room as I was often using my laptop to book futher accomodation or events for my family, ( and check bank balance). It meant I had to either bring the kids down to sit quietly in the lobby or leave them alone in the room. Overall a pleasant stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet only in lobby, busy lift.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Wharf.

review.title: Nice, convenient.
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful and courteous. Room was clean and comfortable for 2 adults and 2 tweens. In house restaurant was ok; a bit overpriced but you pay for convenience. Location was good...within walking distance of tourist attractions.

review.title: Wonderful Stay
review.reviewText: The room was bigger than I expected which was a very pleasant surprise. The beds were a bit too soft for me but that is all in the preference of the sleeper. My husband thought them to be very comfortable. The location is great...you only had to walk a few blocks to get to the wharf. My only complaint was with the showerhead. It had one of those large plate-like shaped heads that make it more like rain. There just wasn't very much pressure and it was hard to rinse. Other than this it was a great experience and I would definitley stay there again
review.negativeRemarks: shower didn't have much pressure
review.locationRemarks: Just few blocks from the wharf

review.title: Decent stay, but room was untidy.
review.reviewText: It was a decent stay, nothing "Wow!" about it. Overall it was ok, but the room was a bit untidy. Our room was obviously not cleaned thoroughly. There were items in the room that were left from a previous guest that were not removed. In particular, there was a half eaten and melted quart of ice cream left in the fridge and a sweater on the floor near the curtains. I can only imagine what other things that may have been "missed" by their staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The uncleanliness in the room

review.title: San Franciso Wharf Fisherman
review.reviewText: Very good hotel with a great location close from the main attraction of san francisco, definitively will come back. Parking overpriced and the room was a bit noisy because directly on the street!
review.negativeRemarks: room a bit noisy
review.locationRemarks: the best location

review.title: Loved this Hotel!
review.reviewText: The marriott is conveniently located and we found everyone on the staff - Valets, front desk - super helpful. The concierge - Michael - was exceptional. His recommendations were terrific and he even told us how to get tickets for the sold out Alcatraz tour! Happy hour (4 - 6) was a great deal. Would definitely return.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: close to Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: "Just right"
review.reviewText:
The hotel was in a great location . It was very clean, pleasant, pretty rooms. Comfy beds,
large TV, coffee maker. Everything was just right,. I enjoyed staying there after long days of sightseeing etc.

review.title: Disappoinging room assignment.
review.reviewText: We were disappointed in the room in that we had expected to have a "junior king suite" and were given what appeared to be just a room with king bed. The view was of the roof albeit there were planters sprinkled around it with blooming flowers brightening up the area. The room was clean and comfortable; the staff friendly and helpful. We had expected more for the additional price we paid for the room.
review.negativeRemarks: They charge for using the computers in their business center--I've stayed in two other hotels where this was a courtesy offered the guests.
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance of most everywhere we wished to go.

review.title: Family Vacation
review.reviewText: Perfect for the family right by Fisherman's Wharf, the Cable car turnaround Lombard st and Ghirardelli. I would stay again.

review.title: Great if you don't have a car.
review.reviewText: Do us all a favor and include parking in the rate. You charged me a total of $54 a night to park my car, that's just stupid money and greed.
review.positiveRemarks: Exceeded my expectations on all points except for parking. Come on and get real with the parking fees.
review.negativeRemarks: The parking fees.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything important on the water front.

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: Great experience from the location, the staff, and the room. We will stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: very near Fisherman's Wharf, the cable cars, and other great sites.

review.title: The good life
review.reviewText: Good location for walking and close to city transportation.

review.title: Nice hotel at a reasonable price!
review.reviewText:
Very quiet and clean room!
Nice staff and helpful concierge.
review.negativeRemarks: Cabbies had a fight right in front of us!
review.locationRemarks: Great touristy location. Easy access to trolley if you aren't driving.

review.title: Convenient and clean.
review.reviewText: This hotel provided a good stay in the city for me and my family. The staff was friendly and courteous and the hotel was clean. Would definitely come back.

review.title: Booking More Than One Room
review.reviewText:
Booked two rooms for my family and when I arrived at the hotel I found out that they were deep cleaning their carpets on the 4th & 5th floors. I called ahead and asked that the rooms be adjoining but when I arrived they moved us twice and when they finally assigned the rooms they where not adjoining. I only got them to say sorry but I wasted about 2 hours moving from room to room!

Like other comments, you can hear street traffic and people talking if your room faces the street and because of the carpet cleaning, I could hear the cleaning crew with their machines going on the street at about 9am, unless your an early riser.

Also, there is no self parking so be prepared to give up your car to the Valet and don't forget to tip$$$$.
review.locationRemarks:
Fisherman's Wharf was fun and lots to see but it won't take up your whole day. Also try Chinatown which is a little over a mile a way. I recommend taking a taxi or the trolly. Kind of hard to find parking and to pay $2 per hour on the meters.

One last place would be the Westfield Mall because it has indoor and outdoor shopping, if you can find parking or pay $$$$$ for public parking if you are driving your own vehicle.

Enjoy your time and dust off your GPS, your going to need it!

review.title: Bettter than ok
review.reviewText: ok met our needs

review.title: Nice Hotel in a Great Location
review.reviewText: The room was small but clean and mostly quiet. Hotel staff was helpful with directions and always friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Wharf - very rustic and colorful with lots to see and do, and good food!

review.title: Marriot
review.reviewText: very nice

review.title: reasonable
review.reviewText: excellent service by bell captains.

review.title: Old But Great Location
review.reviewText:
This Marriott in Fisherman's Wharf is in a great location. It is within walking distance of the cable cars, multiple SF tourist attractions, and many restaurants. It is very small and old though, located on an odd triangular shaped lot. It has NO self parking. Valet only. Try to get the room rate that includes parking package otherwise it is expensive to park there. Also the walls are thin because it is such an old hotel. We stayed on the second floor and outside traffic, especially city buses, were easily heard in the room.
The hotel has no gift shop. The buffet breakfast is located just off the lobby, not in a separate restaurant. There is no in room wifi. Lobby has free wifi but rooms only have internet connection through wires on the desk and is not free. The employees were very friendly and helpful. Except for the concierge who rarely seemed to be at her desk.
Again the best part of this hotel is the location. But there are multiple other hotels within a couple of blocks of this one so next time I may try a different hotel. Especially one with self parking on the premises.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is great because there are so many tourist attractions nearby. It is also where several cable cars stop and turn around. Tour buses are also plentiful and easy to get in this area. It is also less expensive than Union Square.

review.title: cleanliness is next to godliness
review.reviewText: This hotel is a low storey hotel which was fantastic after being 70 floors up in other hotels, it close to the wharf- easy walking distance to pier 39 and hop on off bus stops. The room was spacious and clean and most importantly the bathroom was clean. Good customer service. overall very happy with this property
review.locationRemarks: The wharf area in San Francisco is the place to stay- plenty of restaurants, sightseeing only 5 minutes from the shopping district. The hop on off bus starts and finsihes at the wharf, Alcatraz cruises leave from here. Fantastic location for the whole family

review.title: Fun in San Fran
review.reviewText: The hotel employees were very helpful and nice. The hotel was in a good location, close to main attractions.

review.title: Good Hotel in Wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were very competent and friendly. The room and lobby were a little dated and tired, but ok. Food prices not a good value, so we only ate one breakfast there. Overall, good location and I'd likely stay there again.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: We attended a wedding and then spent 2 days in San Francisco. The location was great because we could take the cable car to Chinatown and since we did rent a car we were able to park at a garage near by the hotel, during the night.

review.title: Excellent Facility
review.reviewText: Will always stay there when in San Fran As far as I'm concerned this deserves a 4 star rating.

review.title: Too Pricey for me.
review.reviewText: When it cost me more to park my rental car at the hotel than it cost me to rent the car, there is something wrong with this picture.

review.title: Enjoyed SF
review.reviewText: Hotel was in an excellent location very easy to get around on the muni transport. Hotel does not offer free wifi not even in the foyer like most other hotels they have a charge of $13- approx per day. The hotel charge was around $20- each for breakfast save some money go acroos the road for a gr8 breakfast. Would recommend anyone going to SF to look at purchasing a city pass excellent value for what you get. Also check out the Golden Gate Park well worth a visit. If wanting to visit Alcatraz book tickets online b4 you leave as the tours get booked out.Interesting city.

review.title: only once in lifetime and that is done now
review.reviewText:
We enjoyed the hotel and trip very much. But we felt that the packet was more expensive through expedia than if we tried to do it ourselves.
In today's economy the cost is very important and i feel expedia which we trust so much could try to be more economical.
Otherwise excellent trip. Thanks expedia

review.title: Great Location but not the usual quality of a marriott
review.reviewText: Renovation was underway, but all staff members I dealt with couldn't have been more helpful. I was disapointed, however, in the overall quality of the hotel. Mattress was very bad with feathers coming out of some type of add on over the mattress. Lumpy. Bathroom was old and plain. Not the usual quality of a Marriott Hotel. But again, Staff members were great!

review.title: Definietly Not Impressed
review.reviewText: While the location of the hotel was good, it had one of the most uncomfortable beds I have ever slept on. Room service was limited and expensive! Way over priced for what you get in my opinion

review.title: a very good location
review.reviewText:
very good location
expensive parking (45$ per day) or use the meters for 3$ per hour
Internet acess with extra charge !

review.title: Average Property
review.reviewText: The hotel was average at best, but in a convenient location. Room was comfortable, but old, and generally I felt the price did not warrant the experience. Mini bar was empty, with no offer to fill it at check-in, and room service was not available at all times of the day. Nothing exciting really, with exception of location.

review.title: What a great place to stay.
review.reviewText:
Very nice clean hotel with excellent staff, very friendly and helpful. Did not even need our car for three days, walked everywhere. Go to Alkatraz but get your tickets early on line because they sell out.

Rooms were very comfortable and quiet. Loved it!!

review.title: This hotel is near everything to see in San Francisco for your first visit.
review.reviewText: When I arrived at the Marriott Hotel everyone that I met was eager to help and to answer any question that I ask .I would reccomend that you don't need to rent a car to see San Francisco. We used mass transit and taxis to get around .

review.title: Would stay here again!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and the staff was extremely nice and helpful. I would stay there again if traveling to San Francisco. I also thought it was in a great location.

review.title: Our new favorite hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We've stayed at The Wharf Inn, Omni and a few other places in San Francisco. This was I think the easiest and most convenient of all of them. On-site parking was a breeze, no waiting out on the street for a valet since they have enough room for many cars to park at check-in and our car was retrieved easily when needed. We checked in at 7pm which meant that we had parking covered for 24 hours even after checking out of the hotel. Staff was all friendly and very pro-active in meeting our needs. Cable car and bus stops & the wharf were very short walks & would be easy for an elderly relative to access. Street noise was a minimum and the fitness facility the best I've seen for this size hotel. Would totally stay here again. Only improvements would be to add the Omni's warm cookies & milk at bedtime and to include a complimentary breakfast to make it perfect! Traveler's tip: Don't miss You's Dim Sum in Chinatown, a local favorite.

review.title: Had a nice time
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, great location.

review.title: Not on Par for a Marriott
review.reviewText: Hard to believe that I was checking into a Marriott. It was not the caliber that is the norm for a Marriott.

review.title: Amazing Stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel could not have been better. We were close to everything that we wanted to do. We had an absolutely wonderful time. Can't wait to go back.

review.title: Excellent Choice
review.reviewText: Everthing about our stay at the Marriott San Francisco Fisherman's Wharf was perfect....not a single complaint.

review.title: San Francisco stay
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the San Francisco Marriott very much. The location is good and you can walk to Pier 39 or to the Cable Car station. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The outside sounds were kept outside and were not bothersome inside at anytime.

review.title: Not that great, renovation on walls made hotel junky
review.reviewText: Everything was adequate but the walls in the hall were being ripped apart and for the price it wasn't that nice.

review.title: Not enough satisfaction for that money
review.reviewText:
I know San Francisco is an expensive city, but for the price we payed I expected at least my breakfast included and wireless internet in my room. I wanted to check my emails in my iPhone, but without wifi, I had to go to the business center. Dissapointing.

By the way... the breakfast wasn't worth the price either.
The rest of the experience was fine.

review.title: Would definitely use again when I'm in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was able to provide us with a room in spite of the fact that we arrived at noon. Additionally the concierge was very helpful in providing restaurant recommendations, directions, and advice on what to do and how to get there. The staff was pleasant and working with them was easy.

review.title: Convenient Location near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Excellent customer service. The staff at the Marriot was excellent, from the front desk to concierge to housekeeping, everyone was friendly and willing to answer any questions we had. The hotel is located conveniently near Fisherman's Wharf and all major tour stops, as well as transportation routes (bus and cable cars). Rooms were clean, although on the small side, which is expected for a "standard room" in major city hotels.

review.title: Worth It
review.reviewText: The hotel is evry centrally located in terms of Fishermans Wharf. You are 2 blocks from the wharf and from the trolly stops. The hotel itself is what you would expect for the money. It is decent but not spectacular. The rooms are nice, but the bathroom is small. The fitness room is excellent and they have a washer and dryer for your use which is a nice touch. Staff were very friendly and were willing to answer any questions. Room service is only available until 10:30. There is a bar but it is small and does not get much traffic at night.

review.title: Great place to stay.
review.reviewText: My sister and I wanted to be close to the SF Wharf for great seafood before we saw Peter Pan. It was in easy walking distance and the desk was helpful for specific directions. We went to Buena Vista for the famous Irish coffee afterwards and that was close by too. So the location was great and the room cozy and comfortable.

review.title: Wonderful Experience.
review.reviewText: Fantastic sweet memories of Stay at San Francisco.Conveniently located-Walgreen,McDonald,Subway,Burger King,Boudin all are within 5 min.The attractions of Fisherman's Wharf are nice & walkable.San Francisco is walking friendly city.

review.title: Will try Marriott again
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly, accommedating and the room as great

review.title: would stay again, the employees were very friendly
review.reviewText: woulld stay again

review.title: Very good hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and helpful. Free internet in lobby. Free laundryservice and free fitness facilities. Good roomsize. Very clean and eco-friendly.

review.title: Mis-managed Hotel.. will never return.
review.reviewText: The hotel management failed to enforce adequate adult supervision over a group of high schoolers, who partied in the hallways, broke the elevators and disturbed guests all night long. I am sending a letter to Starwoods President, Matt Ouimet about my concerns.

review.title: wharf
review.reviewText: nice hotel, but NEVER EVER USE THE SUPER SHUTTLE IN SAN FRANCISCO!!!!!

review.title: "Can't wait to go back"
review.reviewText: We have always had good luck with all Marriots and this one met our expectations. We had a wonderful time in S.F. and will come back and stay at Marriots at Fishermans wharf again!

review.title: Close to all the excitement
review.reviewText: Great experience and the family enjoyed the location. Very close to the cable cars, wharf and food.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great Location. The hotel is two blocks from the water. Very close to Pier 39 where there is a lot to do and close enough to get on the boat to "Alcatraz." The staff at the hotel was pleasant and fairly helpful.

review.title: Louisiana Traveler
review.reviewText: The conceirge service was terrific. They were very polite and extremely helpful. The tours all pick you up at the hotel. The hotel was close to most of the attractions. The price was reasonable for the quality of the rooms and the location. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Great place to stay in Fisherman's Wharf Area
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful in providing directions when needed and offering suggestions for dining, sight seeing, cabs, etc. Cleaning staff was very professional and courteous - also very friendly. Hotel was clean and quiet. Gym was also useful with plenty of treadmills.

review.title: Great hotel, excellent location
review.reviewText:
This was our first stay at this hotel. We got a special rate through Expedia. The room was wonderful. We were able to check -in early and we walked around the neighborhood which was full of wonderful little restaurants. The hotel is located within walking distance of Ghiradelli Square and Pier 39. We even hoofed it to the Ferry Building to check out the Farmer's Market on Saturday.
Nice comfy beds and updated decor. Hotel personnel were very helpful. The only bummer was the $45 parking fee, but that is the case at ALL San Francisco hotels. Parking is at a premium in the big city!

review.title: Vacation
review.reviewText: Avery good experience. The entire staff is great.

review.title: would go back
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff was great except for room service. Took over an hour and 2 phone calls to get a knife and plate. We were then given free breakfast; should have declined. It wasn't very good.
Room was excellent, everyone else was very helpful and caring.

review.title: wouldnt go back
review.reviewText: Was not impressed from the start with the parking situation then because we needed handicap room we were placed at back of hotel with one wall between the fitness center and us and it was noisy and the window wall was right on the street so it was noisy all day and night didnt get much sleep. next time we go up there we will diffenietly find somewhere else to stay

review.title: "Nice stay"
review.reviewText: I'm on the fence about going back, the $45 parking charge is what will stop me from not going back.

review.title: Love the Marriott Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: We had a terrific experience. We had stayed at this hotel before, and were happy to return. The service was great, the room was great and the location is perfect. We used public transportation for our entire visit, and the hotel is also close to the streetcars, the cable cars and the bus stops right across the street.

review.title: Nice place in a convenient area
review.reviewText: Very nice stay. First visit to SF - 25 anniversary. Quite convenient to Wharf and and other Pier attractions. Also convenient to tour buses. Relatively safe area to walk. Staff was excellent. Very nice breakfast - cost extra but worth it. No lunch or evening meals but there are many choices nearby or a short cab ride away.

review.title: Best bang for your buck!
review.reviewText: This hotel was very nice with a helpful and pleasent staff. I didn't have to worry about anything including my car and their were no unexpected surprises at the end of my stay. The parking cost a little money, but it's worth it for the security.

review.title: Will be back
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, staff made us feel at home. Concierge very helpful with guiding us around San Francisco. Took care of reservations, giving us ideas, etc. Definetely talk to him.

review.title: Marriot is A Gem
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with the Marriot Fisherman's Wharf. Rooms were very clean, Hotel staff was very friendly and we had no issues or trouble during our stay. The beds are so amazingly comfortable and that was great after walking all day long. The hotel is within walking distance to the Wharf and Ghirradellis and the trolley car. It had everything we needed.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
This hotel is clean and the staff are extremely courteous and helpful too. Location is very good - just steps away from awesome restaurant Scoma's.
would definitely recommend this hotel!

review.title: Had a great time!
review.reviewText: We had a very nice stay at the Marriot. Everyone was professional and helpful. I would definately stay here again.

review.title: A San Francisco Treat
review.reviewText: Fantastic time in a wonderfully warm and inviting hotel. Will go back. The location is great. Just minutes from everywhere including a great bus tour on a double-decker. Fisherman's wharf wonderful; took a boat tour. Finnegan's Pub almost across the street-wonderful Irish coffee. Loved the whole experience. Room was beautiful; bathroom was grande; and staff friendly.

review.title: would stay here again
review.reviewText:
good location, short walk from many attractions.
amazing service from hotel staff.
very comfortable rooms. the beds were hard to get out of!

review.title: Good value at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Great location, good price, friendly staff, and clean rooms. The only downside was we could not add a rollaway bed to a room with two double beds.

review.title: It was a very good time!!
review.reviewText: We have been to San Francisco twice and both times we had a GREAT time.

review.title: Too expensive for what you get
review.reviewText: Hotel room was fine, and the rate for San Francisco was okay, but the costs for anything like breakfast or a drink in the bar is ridiculous and will certainly keep me from coming back to this hotel. There is no call for a breakfast buffet for four to cost over $100, or a cup of coffee alone to be over $4. With no pool access, and a declining looking neighborhood, I don't think I would come back. But it is a nice hotel on the bus line and near the cable cars, and the concierge is a great guy, very helpful. If you don't mind spending that much for toast and juice, it's okay.

review.title: Excellent hotel!
review.reviewText: The Marriott was very clean and comfortable and the location can't be beat--close to cable car, Ghiradelli, Fisherman's Wharf, North Beach. Really enjoyed our stay and had to be the most comfortable bed I've slept in in quite awhile. The Bath and Body Works toiletries are a nice touch as well.

review.title: Very comfortable.
review.reviewText: Hotel was very good. We stayed 5 couple for 2 nights and evereybody enjoyed to stay there.

review.title: Wonderful location
review.reviewText: The room was lovely and the bed was very comfortable. We celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary here! Our only complaint was the noise from downstairs, it sounded like a trash compactor that was in use most of the time. We never complained to anyone though so we are not aware of how they would handle that situation. The location was perfect as we were able to walk to many places, and being near Fisherman's Wharf is fantastic! All of the employees were so very nice and always greeted us when we passed by them. We would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Great - except forgot or wake up call the day of our early am flight!
review.reviewText: Great hotel and location! Would give a PERFECT review - but they forgot our early am wake up call, and we almost missed our flight. We would have except we reserved a taxi who was terrific!

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. close to everything including trasnportation. Staff always available. hotel safe is in the drawer in each room. Not much view becuase all of the hotel's are close together but great place to basecamp.

review.title: Perfect Hotel
review.reviewText: Great business trip, close to the water for the after meeting hours and friendly service for meals and front desk.

review.title: Never disappointed
review.reviewText: It was our third stay at the Marriott@Fisherman's Wharf, always clean and friendly.

review.title: Marriott Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel with a good location. Parking is pricey, but that's the case everywhere in SF. I would recommend it.

review.title: It is a very nice hotel with very friendly people to help answer any questions.
review.reviewText: I would return to this hotel it was very clean, smoke-free and all the employees were willing to help out to find great places to see or eat.

review.title: Great location near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Very nice. Only disappointment was the expensive breakfast. McDonalds conveniently located just a few blocks away.

review.title: Great Fisherman Wharf location
review.reviewText: Hotel is within easy walking distance to the wharf and Pier 39 activities, as well as Ghiradelli Square, the Cannery, and many other places. Lots of things to do in the area. Recommend paid shuttle service from airport, in lieu of rental car. Hotel staff pleasant and willing to point out locations and give directions.

review.title: impressed with hotel for being in a very high tourst area, very clean & friendly.
review.reviewText: a great place,easy to get around the city from hotel. Public transportation is very close by. Hotel is clean & upgdaded. Would stay again.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: For a first time visit to San Francisco, this hotel is great, the hotel is located only 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, where you will find many of the most popular attractions and tours in Bay, aswell transport links into the city. The service was good and the staff were always happy to help. The hotel was undergoing some minor work on the outside of the building, however this was not a problem.

review.title: arrived early
review.reviewText: We arrived early so my concern was getting the room I requested. The front desk ask for my cell number called with in an hour, had my king bed as I requested. I was infromed the corner king bed room were smaller, so the wait was worth it.

review.title: First Time in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I was very happy with this hotel. The location is great!!! Right by Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiradelli Square and the starting point for our hop on/hop off bus tour. Also a short walking distant from North Beach where there are some fantastic italian restaurants and cafes....Had a wonderful trip!

review.title: Would definelty go back!
review.reviewText: The location was exceptional. Bed was very comfortable. Room was quiet for the most part.

review.title: Very good location.
review.reviewText: First time visitors to San Francisco so needed help with sightseeing to get the best for our visit. The hotel position was just perfect for all we wanted to do with easy walks to sights. The staff were very helpful our room comfortable and very clean with free use of room-safe for valuables. Definetly a return visit would be good.

review.title: Great location - rooms a little on small side, but nice hotel
review.reviewText: Stay 9/10-9/13/09 for a wedding. Beds very comfortable. Clean hotel within walking to everything near Fishermnan's Wharf. Concierge very helpful. Most family stayed here and others stayed at a hotel a few doors down. That one was very nice (much bigger rooms). Bad side is a busy street and could hear alot of traffic. Nice bar in hotel. Also, has a airport check-in kiosk in lobby.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel was very clean, close to cable cars, warf area, walking distance to northbeach, and other areas of interest. Staff was very nice.

review.title: San Fransico,s best location,Photographers dream.
review.reviewText: Hotel is very convenient to all major attractions.Marriott is clean well maintained and the staff very accomodating.Abel a hotel employee is very knowlegeable with regards to the city and most helpfull.Eric was also always there to assist with suggestions.We will stay at this hotel again.Take your camera as the hotel is close to many great attractions,Whalers Wharf,China Town,North Beach Little Italy Etc.

review.title: Thoroughly enjoyed
review.reviewText: We stayed here for the first time and loved it. The location is excellent. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The bed was outrageously comfy and they didn't skimp on the amount of pillows they gave you either! Highly recommendable! We'll be back

review.title: Great locale for exploring Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Overall the Hotel was great. The locale was very convenient to the Wharf and the hotel itself satisfied my needs. Room service was efficient and timely and the valets were great for finding cabs and arranging transportation. The best convenience of the hotel was the check-in hub down at the main desk. I would stay again in a heart beat.

review.title: Great Downtown Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location for Fisherman's Wharf and other attractions. Rooms were big and clean.

review.title: What a friendly place!
review.reviewText: This hotel has the friendliest staff I have ever encountered, from the bellman, to the front desk to the chambermaids! The room we had was newly renovated and very clean and comfortable. Very convenient location. I would definitely return.

review.title: When a Hotel is Just a Hotel
review.reviewText: The Hotel is great...The location is even better...We traveled by train so we did not have a car and found out we did not even need one...the public transportaion was awesome...the one thing I could complain about was that our room was not fresh...I luv to walk in a room and smell freshness...it was a little stale...i wish i would have brought my febreeze bottle...but otherwise i cannot comment on anything else since we did not spend too much time in the actual hotel...too much to see and do...

review.title: Planning our next trip !!!
review.reviewText: we had a wonderful weekend at the Marriott. We wanted to eat seafood and that's what we did. The location was pefect. Close to the Wharf!!! Trolley cars, no need for a cab, except to and from the airport.We walked everywhere. The downfall if you drive...it's $45 a day to park your vehicle. That was what the cab cost us each way.

review.title: Great service
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay very much. Great location, and wonderful service.

review.title: Where we always stay
review.reviewText: Excellent location, friendly staff, sufficient hotel room, easy transportation access are just four reasons why we always stay at the Marriott at Fisherman's Wharf. For business or leisure (with the grandkids), it's our "comfort" spot with easy access to taxis, bus lines, North Beach, etc.

review.title: Marriott Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, location was optimal, service was great!

review.title: shark fest destination
review.reviewText: great location

review.title: This was a return trip to this hotel for us which says it all
review.reviewText: Very comfortable and very conveniently located with respect both to Fisherman's wharf and to transport connections to down town.

review.title: Alot of work going on at hotel
review.reviewText: Driving up to hotel they had a wet vac out by the front door !! I was like! Oh my god alot of work going on at hotel . We had a view of scaffles not very happy

review.title: Great hotel,avoid restaraunt
review.reviewText: This hotel is great and in a very convenient location, but i would avoid the resterant. The prices are high and the quality of the service is low. The restaraunt here is the only place on a week long trip that we experienced less than exceptional service. Stay at the hotel, eat elswhere.

review.title: best location for walking around Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: I was very thankful for the extra time that was spented by Mike,the desk bellman,helping me with a problem with my camera. He was very patience while working on sending a picture that had to be emailed to a newspaper for an article by the next day. Every employee that I came in contact with was very nice and helpful from the door bellmen to the front desk, to the housekeepers.

review.title: Easy walk to the Wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel facilities great, staff could be more helpful. Not good at directions or providing a map.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location.
review.reviewText: Hotel was neat, clean, had comfortable rooms for myself and two of my kids. Location, two blocks from Fishermans Wharf was ideal for us, as tourists. Lack of free WiFi and $45/night "valet" charge for parking car was a little disappointing for a hotel with a moderately price. Would certainly consider this hotel for another stay, but would compare with other similar national chains all located nearby.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: The hotel location was great. Located close to eveything we wanted to do. Would stay there again.

review.title: loved it
review.reviewText: it was a lovely hotel, with wonderful service from check-in to final check-out. beautiful, clean room. we were within walking distance of fisherman's wharf and wonderful restaurants. we are planning to go back next year!

review.title: very very nice,would stay here again.
review.reviewText: the room was very nice,but the comfort of the beds was super like sleeping on a cloud.best nights sleep we ever had in a hotel.

review.title: Great Location and service.
review.reviewText: The great hotel service and ease of commuting to all of the city's sites and attractions, through walking or the public transportatioin system, has garaunteed my choice for future stays. For those that intend to use a car expect to pay for valet parking. There is very limited parking avilable on the street but within 100 yards of the hotel one can find public/overnight parking for a fraction of the valet charge.

review.title: Take Comfortable Shoes!
review.reviewText: Hotel is just a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and very convenient to other public transportation. Hotel staff is friendly and very helpful. I recommend that you take the cable car to Union Station and then to Chinatown. If you like to walk, it's a downhill walk back to the hotel from Chinatown. There are some great little stops on the way down the hill, and it isn't a bad walk.

review.title: Excellent stay and wonderful staff
review.reviewText: The Marriott Fisherman's Wharf Hotel is a great place to stay when visiting San Francisco. It is close to good restaurants and shopping!

review.title: Clean and convenient
review.reviewText: This Marriott is wonderfully close to Fisherman's Wharf. Starbucks and Walgreens just across the street which was great for coffee and small items. Parking rate is ridiculous $40.00 - but all hotels in San Francisco are. The day valet for the parking acted like we were bothering - no tip for him. Would stay again because it was clean and the other hotel staff were helpful.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: We had a very pleasent stay at this hotel. Great location. We were able to walk to just about everyplace we wanted to see. Would definitely stay again!

review.title: Great Hotel, Fantastic Staff, Super location!!
review.reviewText: The staff at this hotel was wonderful from checking in to checking out and everything in between! It was nice to be welcomed back by one or more of the various staff when I returned from a day outing. The rooms were spacious and had wonderful featherbeds on top of the mattresses and even down comforters! I would go back in a heartbeat!! No wonder my heart remains in San Francisco.

review.title: All Around Great
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpful and always informative. The beds are the most comfortable I've ever slept on. The hotel is convenient to Fisherman's Wharf, cable cars, and other sights.

review.title: Great Price - Great Location
review.reviewText: I only needed a room for one night as we were staying in other areas of CA - wanted to stay near the Wharf for a reasonable price. The location was perfect, room very clean and large and accomdating staff. I would stay here again.

review.title: Ideal as a base.
review.reviewText: Hotel was ideal as a base as it was 5 minutes walk from Fishermans Wharf and the Cable Car stop. The Sighseeing bus is well worth a try too. I am not generally 'a tourist', but that trip was useful for finding out all about the Downtown area and the hosts were excellent. The hotels is different from the British Marriott hotels, not as private. You can hear through the walls and connecting doors as crying babies and rowing couples at 11pm! But it is comfortable, clean and the staff are excellent.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: If you want to be near Fisherman's Wharf, this is an excellent place to stay. Very quite and near all transportation. The front desk employees were very accommondating in assisting with our needs.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: We a had a great experience and the Marriot in Fisherman's Wharf. We were so close to the wharf and it was very convenient to get to the city as well. The staff was very friendly and the rooms were very clean and comfortable. For the price and location, I would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Awesome!
review.reviewText: Fast check-in, clean and well-appointed rooms, friendly staff, close proximity to Fisherman's Wharf, trolley lines, and Ghirardelli Square. Not a lot of nightlife, but that's not the hotel's fault.

review.title: fluffy beds
review.reviewText: The room was very nice, but small and newly redecorated. We had no problems with check in, actually we were able to get into our room at 11:30AM.

review.title: Good stay if you are not driving
review.reviewText: The Marriott is a good hotel -- clean rooms, nice atmosphere, and within easy walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, shops, restaurants and a good comedy club. The overnight parking was steep, though, and the hotel staff was not very helpful in suggesting anywhere else.

review.title: Fabulous - would definitely stay here again
review.reviewText: The decorations were beautiful and bedding was very luxurious. The bed very comfortable but narrow, did not feel like a "full size bed. Our room was super clean and odor free we appreciated the "no smoking atmosphere".

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, perfect location! Close to everything and very comfortable

review.title: Good location, good service
review.reviewText: I have stayed here twice and would stay again. The hotel is close to Fisherman's Wharf attractions and the cable car lines. Muni bus lines stop in front of the hotel too. Staff is friendly and knowledgable about visitor information. The only negative: on my last visit, one elevator was broken for 4 of the 5 days we were there, causing some long waits, especially in the morning.

review.title: Better than we expected.
review.reviewText: The hotel employees were very friendly, courteous, and extremely helpful. Consierge were very knowledgeable and offered many tips for getting around the city. Great location, walked everywhere and felt safe doing so. The workout room has several types of equipment with fresh towels, fruit, water. Washer/drier available for guests and business center w/ free internet access. In-room refrigerators were convenient with Trader Joe's and Safeway markets close by (5-6 block walk). Beds were very comfortable and hotel was quiet.

review.title: Hotel Overview
review.reviewText: Clean, quiet, and very friendly staff. Nothing special, good value for the money as long as you are getting a discount on your stay. Bar very quite, not much to do in the hotel it self, no pool, the restaurant has a great breakfast but lunch and dinner are average with the wharf close by it loses as an option for the price. Bell hop service quick to assist with taxis and directions but slow with luggage assistance. Would give the hotel a 3 star rating for over all

review.title: Was a excellent Time no but at all
review.reviewText: We are a Family of 4 people The reservation was made by my daughter she has 19 years old, was a really surprise that she choice a good hotel, The hotel is near of every thing, I rentd 2 rooms one with a King bed and the other with a doble bed for them. We eated ones the brefast and the cost was $ 71 without tips was a buffet and was super fine. You can eat at Dennys but in the pier you have a several excellent restaurant such as Castanogla's is a italian food, Houston, and behind of Castanoglan's has the best restaurant in sea food I dont remember the name now..Back to the Hotel the room has a coffe maker, and a little fridge...the bed was excelent and the pillow too...very clean all the time the room and the hotel, also is smoke free...WE spend one week from the september 05 till september 12 of 08....Before go to this Hotel we been in Los Angeles and one week before in the Sheraton.. that was good too but I high recomended this hotel the Marriott... if you go in vacation with your family and enjoy your time in San Franncisco ahhhhhhhhh the store in the Pier are more cheaply than the chinatonw and donwtonw

review.title: Anniversary Trip
review.reviewText: First visit to San Francisco and we enjoyed our stay, celebrating our 31st Wedding Anniversary, the staff was very kind and helpful everyone was cheerful and did their jobs very well and professional, we would use this hotel again on our next visit, we were very impress with such with the great customer service we recieved from everyone, thanks for making our anniversary so memorable

review.title: Great Location and Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed here for our Honeymoon and were very happy to find how nicely located this hotel was. It's very close to most of the things tourists to San Francisco will want to see like Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown, the Alcatraz site, etc. The hotel was clean, service was excellent and the staff was very friendly and very nice. The parking was a little more expensive than some of the other hotels but it was a lot right there at the hotel, not some remote site two blocks away like some of the hotels feature. We would stay there again.

review.title: Good hotel but expensive parking!
review.reviewText: Hotel was great, and great location, too. We didn't realize beforehand that the parking costs $43 per DAY! Otherwise, great place to stay.

review.title: Good choice.
review.reviewText: Centrally located, a nice hotel. Moderately priced, good service.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: No hotels in the area are new, but the Marriott is clean, comfortable and in a good location. Fridge in the room is great and there is a grocery store less than 2 blocks away.

review.title: Very friendly
review.reviewText: The hotel was wonderful - our entire stay was extremely pleasant. The staff always greeted us and was very personable. I was unable to eat at the hotel restaurant, because I have a latex allergy and they wear latex gloves to prepare the food. Other than that, our stay at the hotel was perfect.

review.title: Best of the Best
review.reviewText: I had a great stay, and was in walking distance to great attraction. Hotel was clean and the services were top notch.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: They wanted to give somthing different that I paid for. We've got the room at 4:00 pm, even if we were there at 10:30 am. I know from a confident source from the hotel that they did have rooms available at the time when we got there, but because we did not accepeted what they offered, a room with one bed for all three of us, they made us to wait until 4:00 pm. Not nice and not friedly personnel.

review.title: A wonderful Experience
review.reviewText: Smack dab in the middle of the action, this hotel was everything we expected. The concierge was very helpful and the room was neat and comfortable. We were very happy to see that a washer and dryer were on premises. They were a very nice amenity. Overall I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

review.title: You get what you pay for....
review.reviewText: I recently had the opportunity to stay in the Marriot Hotel at Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco. I do not often stay at Marriots because I am a bargain shopper and they are usually a little more expensive than I like to pay. I was very impressed with Marriot. The service is excellent. The staff went out of the way to meet our every need. The only negative part of my stay was the feather top comforter they place between the mattress and fitted sheet. We found them to be uncomfortable and asked for them to be removed. In just a matter of minutes housekeeping came to our room and removed the cover. Although I will continue to be a bargain shopper, I won't mind paying extra to stay at a Marriot. You do get what you pay for and it was worth every penny!

review.title: Great City, but next time, a different hotel
review.reviewText: I am a regular Marriott (Silver Elite) user and I like their consistently high quality and good service. This is the most unfavorable experience I have had with a Marriott. First the good - Nice location, just off the honky-tonk of Fisherman's Wharf, and close to attractions and transportation. Desk, porter and hotel staff are the typical fine Marriott Standard. Rooms are good size (suggest in inside room-outside rooms can be noisy due to traffic and bus stops) Now the less than good - The beds are awful! We refused a room due to the failed mattress, and they gave us another, that was just as bad. When I went to the desk, they offered a bed board which make the bed only tolerable. My back was aching for a quality night sleep. There was a fire alarm in the hotel one evening, and the porter staff went around to assure everyone to ignore it. We did not, and waited outside for the fire trucks to leave. I wonder why Marriott daily charges for internet are what I pay for a month at home. At very secluded motor inns in Northern Nova Scotia last year, they all had free internet. We had a wonderful visit to San Francisco, but will seek out another hotel next time (maybe try hotels which advertise their high quality beds)

review.title: One complaint
review.reviewText: My only complaint about the hotel was that the bed was too soft, otherwise location was great and we felt very safe walking the area at night.

review.title: Nice Stay!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our recent stay very much. Our requests for more coffee and specific pillows were met with immediate response. The feather beds were really nice and comfy too. Good location between the cable car turn arounds and also midway between ghiradelli square and pier 39.

review.title: Tiny rooms, little soundproofing
review.reviewText: Our room was on the 4th floor overlooking (busy) Columbus Ave. Because of the hills, much of the traffic is essentially right outside the window, even four floors up. The soundproofing on the Columbus side is totally inadequate - the windows are essentially single-pane and openable. All night long we were kept up by the sounds of traffic below. On top of that, our specific room (476) was TINY - you could not walk in front of the bed with the TV cabinet doors open. One night, our room keys all spontaneously stopped working. The door lock would flash yellow but not open. We had to keep going to the front desk to let us into our own room because engineering would not be available until 9 the next morning. Overall I won't be back - there are many nicer and quieter looking hotels within a block of this one.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Our stay in San Francisco at the Marriot Fisherman's Wharf was an excellant experience. The location was great for sightseeing. Everything was in walking distance. The bus tours all picked us up at the hotel entrance.

review.title: Great location in the wharf.
review.reviewText: Very helpful staff in selecting activities to explore. Very clean and well situated in the wharf area of SF.

review.title: Cozy and clean!
review.reviewText: This hotel played a great part of our vacation in San Fran. After a long day of walking, the comfortable beds were amazing! Cant wait to go again!

review.title: a little disappointed
review.reviewText: We thought it had a pool & it didn't Furniture in rooms was very dated

review.title: Marriott San Fran Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel is very convenient. It is one block from the wharf. Beds were very comfortable also. Only bummer is they have no pool or hot tub.

review.title: We had a great stay
review.reviewText: We spent 4 enjoyable nights at this hotel. The room was spacious, the king-sized bed was most comfortable with a down mattress pad underneath and a down comforter on top. Every employee was friendly and helpful. A concierge was available in the lobby. We enjoyed the convenient and delicious buffet breakfast each day. It was a good location: on bus lines, a short walk to a cable car, and to Fisherman's Wharf attractions.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: parking is a joke and I am meaning the price for which a guess pays $43.00 a night. nothing is offered for free parking

review.title: Good accomodations
review.reviewText: Nice hotel right on the Wharf. Nothing exceptional, but clean and close to all Wharf activities, the Presidio, cable cars, etc.

review.title: Great & easy location
review.reviewText: Great hotel, too crowded, service was great!

review.title: jw
review.reviewText: Spada Restaurant is too pricey! Could not even get a cup of coffee in the morning for less than $3

review.title: Pleasant Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in a great location - easy access to local tourist attractions and transportation to other sites. The hotel staff is awesome, a great example of teamwork. They were very pleasant and accommodating. They added to our overall vacation experience.

review.title: Nice hotel with great location to begin sightseeing
review.reviewText: Nice hotel and its right next to the wharf which made for easy access to some of the tourists spots. Staff was very nice and helpful. The only downfall was the sandpaper towels. I dont think they have ever heard of downey. Overall a pleasant experience.

review.title: Would definitely stay here again.
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpful. The concierge was the best with helping us get into all the tours we wanted. They were also very helpful with directions.

review.title: Easy access to the Fisherman's Wharf area - and to most transportation in S.F. A good stay!
review.reviewText: The hotel met or exceeded our expectations regarding avaiability, cleanliness, food service, etc. One of the best Fisherman's Wharf options.

review.title: Wonderful Vacation Stay
review.reviewText: Great hotel, good location, just blocks away from many restaurants, shopping and sightseeing spots. I would have stayed before but was skeptical of the past reviews I saw.

review.title: California 2008 Family Trip
review.reviewText: Hotel is very old 7o's look. Geat Location for Fishermans Wharf. Extremely expensive Parking overnight $ 32.00 Water Bottels overpriced. Excellent breakfats

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: This is my second time and I love this hotel. Clean, family friendly and close to all the attractions at Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Great location, expensive parking, small room for 4
review.reviewText: The hotel is well located and the staff very friendly. Parking cost more than one days car rental ($50 per night). The room for four is very tight and the two beds are small. There is no free WLAN. For location however the hotel is excellent. Fishermans wharf is very lively and you can get the tram to Union Square within a two minute walk from the hotel. The Bridge is not far away. Overall a good choice, especially when the excellent breakfast is included.

review.title: Very friendly place
review.reviewText: We have spent time in dozens of hotels and find that service is key. Although not particularly expensive, this hotel, especially the front desk staff, especially Corey, went out of their way to greet us warmly and help in any way they could. The bedding is exptrememly comfortable; I want to buy it! But the room was not immaculate. Clean, but not spotless; if I were staying longer I might request a little extra attention in that area. Plus the liter water bottles they leave in your room are only four dollars - we've seen so much worse!

review.title: Wonderful Experience
review.reviewText: Totally pleased with hotel staff to answer every question we had during our stay. One word of advice for those allergic to down bedding, kindly ask housekeeping for change out of all down bedding and will do so promptly. Finally, recommendations of concierge's team with city sites and diner's definitely sealed our commitment to return to this hotel.

review.title: Would go back again
review.reviewText: Hotel employees very friendly. Ideal location close to shops, food and night life.

review.title: Probably will try a different hotel next time!
review.reviewText: Room comfort was ok, nothing great. Bathroom was very small. Housekeeping were on top of things if we requested anything they brought it very quickly. Restaurant in hotel was very very expensive for breakfast; not worth price. Rented a car 1 day to go to Muir woods and was told by rental car place we could find parking on the street over night for free. There was no parking anywhere near our hotel and had to park it at hotel for a very extremely high price + tax. It was ridiculous. Staff did seem very helpful.

review.title: Close to Everything
review.reviewText: We stayed here over the July 4th weekend. The hotel is older, but immaculately maintained, and the staff is courteous and very helpful.We were very impressed with how quiet the room was....we heard no noise from other units at all. Only negative is the fact that there is no free Wi-Fi internet. You have to pay to use ethernet connection in your room, or pay the same for wireless access in the lounge. They do have a "business" center with two ancient desktops and a printer, so, if you can get the kids off them, they are there for your "quick" use. Hotel is 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, 2 blocks from cable car terminal, and SF Muni bus stops right at the door. We'll stay here again if we go back. Highly recommended.

review.title: Love this Marriott
review.reviewText: Great staff, friendly, courteous and helpful. Food was delightful! Also, very clean rooms.

review.title: the staff are are very good
review.reviewText: hotel is convenient for everything cable car street car bus away from the noisy road two blocks away from transportation.quiet and and we have a good time only the weather wasnt cooperating was cold

review.title: good hotel...
review.reviewText: hotel is nice..good location if you are going to do all the sightseeing...bus stop right in front of the hotel and you have complimentary internet use....

review.title: Staff extremely friendly and helpful with suggestions as needed
review.reviewText: The only dissatisfaction was with Internet access, for access from room they wanted to charge $12.95 per day, I think this is ridiculous for the price of the hotel. Told us there was free access in the lobby, however this was really in a very small room called the business center that had wireless, In this day and age, you need to provide internet access free of charge.

review.title: Very Nice!
review.reviewText: Service was excellent,

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: This hotel on fisherman's wharf made it so easy to walk, catch a bus or trolly anywhere. We were able to get most everywhere in the city in less than 30 minutes..even the airport!

review.title: The Marriott at Fisherman's Wharf met all my expectations.
review.reviewText: The Hotel met all my expectations. From the ease of check in to the availability of the concerige to the comfort of the room. The pillow top mattress on the bed was very comfortable. Daily maid service was great. Fisherman's Wharf and all the attractions were within walking distance. I can't think of anything negative to say about our 5 day stay at the Marriott at Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay at the Marriott. Hotel was clean and rooms were clean staff very friendly and knowledgeable. The location was great and close to Fisherman's wharf where there are a lot of great places to eat and trolley cars are just a block away. We really enjoyed our stay, and will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: We wrestled with the bed for the entire stay...mattress was old but was disguised by a pillow top and sheets that were too small to hold it down...this became nothing more than a very uncomfortable lump of linen in the center of the bed!...couldn't wait to get home to my own bed for some rest!

review.title: Fabulous service
review.reviewText: The most impressive thing about the Marriott was the client service- the concierge, bellman, everyone was very helpful. I highly recommend this hotel!

review.title: Excellent place to stay
review.reviewText: Hotel was excellent location when visiting San Francisco. Trolly car, local transportation and Fisherman's Wharf easily available. If returning to Frisco at any time, would be happy to stay there. The beds were awsome...kids loved them...

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our 7 night stay at the Marriott- Fisherman,s Wharf. Room quality was good and staff was excellent. We found the valet parking quite expensive although the service was good. Food selection and quality was average and fairly expensive at the hotel, but this was no problem since there is so much good food available a short walk away

review.title: a nice expierence
review.reviewText: This is a wonderful hotel to stay at we were very pleased with the service.

review.title: Decent and near transportation
review.reviewText: You're a block or two away from the Powell-Mason cable car line, and from the "F" streetcar, both of which are good transportation jumping-off points. There was a rasta homeless guy who frequented the Jones Street side of the hotel, and we also got hit on for money or leftover dinner by a wheelchair-bound homeless guy who parked on the public sidewalk right on an entrance path. Very disconcerting. By the third of our fourth days, we had one of two toilet paper rolls left, one was not replaced, and the other down to a few winds before we would've had to ask for help. The facial tissues ran were allowed to run down to three sheets. It seemed like a little too much attention to economy on the hotel's part. Also, $43 a day to park a rental car seemed like a slap in the face. Don't forget to tip the valet who brings you the $430-a-day vehicle.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The whole trip was wonderful. Thank you

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Hotel was located within walking distance of almost everything.

review.title: Better for a holiday that business
review.reviewText: I was there for a week on vacation and for this the hotel is great - clean, tidy, comfortable and near the main tourist attractions, but I needed to do a couple of days work and keep in touch with the office. Having been in San Francisco a few times on business only I have stayed in various other hotels and this is the first one that I have stayed in that charges for internet access unless you use a wired connection in their "business centre", which is a corridor with a shelf along one wall. Wireless and room access is chargeable by the day - and very expensive.

review.title: I plan to go back in November or December
review.reviewText: The staff was extremely helpful with all questions asked. I plan to go back to the same hotel when Gary Danko opens his second restaurant near by. As a matter of fact Gary Danko's restaurant was within walking distance, only one and half blocks away.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location with easy access to F-Line (street car) and cable cars making travel throughout the city effortless. Hotel clean and staff friendly. We were able to check in very early which was greatly appreciated and check out was a breeze. Would stay there again.

review.title: Great , clean, extremely friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Hotel was always spotless. Staff was always ready to help with any questions we had.

review.title: Enjoyed our stay.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Marriott. The deal we got seemed great when you compared it to others in the area. The only thing about the room we didn't like was the feather bed that was on top of our matress--comfortable, but it seemed as though it was falling off every morning when we woke up. However, it was a small detail and we would definitely go back.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: The room wasn't ready till 4PM, the front desk was downright rude.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location, just a block from the trolley, a few block from the cable car and just a block to walk onto Fisherman's wharf. Even getting to Chinatown was only about 7 blocks. Staff is very friendly, no matter who you are speaking to or what time of day. Rooms are very clean and well stocked. Only downside was the ice machine was WAY at the end of the hall and around a few corners from our room. After a day walking up & down all those hills...sure wish the ice was closer! lol So many things within walking distance! Pier 39, Ghiradelli square, Fisherman's wharf, Chinatown, North Beach, Union Square...great hotel with great location!

review.title: Great Beds
review.reviewText: Very comfortable bed (soft); quality bedding. Good temperature control in room. Had to get door re-keyed twice; when maintenance man arrived to check door, he said he needed to replace the door lock (at our convenience).

review.title: Very comfortable beds
review.reviewText: Staff was courteous and helpful. Room was very clean and comfortable. However, my room as a very long walk from the elevator.

review.title: San Francisco I will return
review.reviewText: Outstanding service, everyone was friendly and most helpful. Great location to the wonderful areas of SF, a must place to stay.

review.title: Great home base for San Francisco Warf area.
review.reviewText: Hotel was very clean, in good repair, and a welcome sight after a hard day of being a tourist. I recommend it highly.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, and close to the trolley's, shopping, wharf, piers, and cable cars. But the parking was overpriced at half a benjamin a night! Next time I go to San Fran I'll stay here but I will fly into San Francisco Airport, take a shuttle to hotel, buy a 48 hour hop on hop off tour ticket, and use the public transportation. I would have saved like 3 benjamins that way.

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText: Location is conveint to walk to Warf area resturants

review.title: Older but comfortable, reasonable rooms. Great location!
review.reviewText: We were very happy with our room at the Marriott at Fisherman's Wharf from the big, comfy feather bed atop the mattress, to the tons of pillows, spacious room and quiet location. We even had a room right by the elevator and never once had any issues with noise. The room can equipped with a coffeemaker and Starbucks coffee, which we enjoyed everyday as well as a refrigerator which was handy for leftovers from the great restaurants in San Francisco. The hotel staff was very polite and friendly and provided us with a very helpful map upon arrival that we used frequently during our stay.
