The hotel is about 2 blocks from the Hyde Street cable car stop, which we used frequently along with a number of bus lines that will get you to the west part of San Francisco. There is a Trader Joe's grocery store a couple of blocks away, which we used to stock up snacks in our room and 2 Walgreen's drug stores just a couple of blocks in either direction for other supplies. Also, there is a Starbucks very close to the hotel near another major cable car stop and also in the hotel/lobby restaurant area, but we did not use this one during our stay. All in all, a great hotel for a first visit with a handy neighborhood for about everything you could want!

review.title: Great Family spot
review.reviewText: Location was great; close but quiet. Concierge services were a great help!! We would definitely recommend this hotel. We had kids in age ranges from 10 - 16 and they were all happy here.

review.title: Great Location & Service
review.reviewText: Location! Location! Location! Perfect for firsttime visitors to San Francisco. Can get to hotel with the train and a short bus ride for under $8. Great service and quite comfortable. Feather pillows and soft beds are incredibly comfortable. Room was kept extremely clean. Only complaint was there was no alarm clock in room. Hotel provides a free wine tasting on Wednesdays and the glasses are well plenished. Would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Nice and Useful Staff
review.reviewText: Good hotel with nice and useful staff.

review.title: Great location and friendly staff
review.reviewText: My husband and I have been to San Fran several times, but always stayed with family in North Beach, so this stay in a hotel was a first. The Marriott is in a great location; easy walk to Wharf, North Beach, China Town . . . if you don't care to walk, buy the City Pass and you can ride the cable cars free and use the MUNI bus system; pass also comes with other freebies. The hotel staff was more than friendly; we didn't use the concierge much, but when we did they were super helpful. I recommend doing so especially if you don't know the area. Even if you do, they have good inside info. Everytime we walked by they were helping people and seemed to be very patient and above & beyond in their service. Property is a bit worn but still very nice and super clean (at least what we experienced). The room comes with a fridge which was a big plus, and I think you can ask for a microwave. Blow dryer is in the room and it's not one of those awkward ones attached to the wall - it's a full size sitting in a bag on the vanity. One issue; they advertise the "Revive" bed, but it is a normal king bed with a feather top . . . had trouble most every night with the fitted sheet popping off the corners exposing the topper and you could feel feathers through the sheets. Not a huge deal, and when things stayed together, the bed was more comfortable than many I've stayed in. Overall, it was a great value, great location and wonderful vacation.

review.title: We will be staying there again!
review.reviewText: This hotel was walking distance to the Wharf, great restaurants, and sites. The hotel staff was very informative, knowledgeable and friendly. The hotel room was clean, spacious, with large windows overlooking the Bay! My husband and I loved it so much, that when will go back again next year for our vacation, we will be staying at this Marriott.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and in a great location for the price. The concierge desk was very helpful with restaurant suggestions. Very knowledgeable staff.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: The hotel was in an ideal location--close to the Wharf and Giardelli Square,restaruants, and transportation. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. The room was comfortable--especially the beds. I would definitely go back to the same hotel again.

review.title: We absolutely loved this hotel . The location was perfect!
review.reviewText: Our experience at this hotel was wonderful. The staff were always friendly, welcoming us upon our return from site seeing. The concierge was very helpful in guideing us with the transportation in your wonderful city. Location of this hotel is terrific, close to all you want to see and do in san francisco we would definately stay here again. The bed is so comfortable, just like a cloud.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: its nice hotel, close for everything. hotel parking is expensive. and the bed is very soft.

review.title: Can't beat the location
review.reviewText: The Marriott Fisherman's Wharf was so convenient and easy to get to everything in just a matter of minutes! We were delighted because it made our trip not only easy but stress free, if we needed to pop in and get a change of clothes or just relax before we headed out again it was in walking distance from almost anywhere we happen to be. The best thing of all is staying here means no added headache of needing a rental car.

review.title: Very comfortable beds
review.reviewText: Small rooms and not much of a view but beds very comfortable and plenty of amenities in room. Refrigerator, hair dryer, coffee maker, iron and board, etc. Just a few minutes walk from cable cars, bus lines and wharf activities. Concierge very helpful in suggesting places to go and things to do using BART. Would gladly return.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: I am glad we did not stay at Downtown/Union Square area during our family trip to San Francisco last week. It was two blocks away from Fisherman's Wharf, but relaxing and quiet. Best of all, the hotel is VERY convenient to all transportations: Cable cars, Street cars and Ferries.

review.title: Marriott Fisherman's Wharf - enjoyable place to stay
review.reviewText: Hotel and room were comfortable and clean; staff friendly and helpful. Parking was expensive but convenient.

review.title: Not worth the Cost!
review.reviewText: This Marriott looks good in the Public areas, however the rooms have not been updated in MANY years. The bed was very old and they "tried" to make it seem better by placing a Featherbed top on it, this provided feathers sticking through the sheets and poking you as you sleep. Oh yeah, the Sheets were not big enough to fit over the featherbed, so as soon as you get into bed the bottom sheet comes off....very nice. The Desk Chair was a straight back chair, the only other chair is about 30 years old and looks and feels like it.....small room a place to sleep only, but not even that was comfortable........ The people who work their were friendly enough, but the hotel is NOT worth what they charge! Not even close!

review.title: Great empolyees that really took the time to help us
review.reviewText: Close to everything.

review.title: Awesome hotel
review.reviewText: I was very well satisfied with my stay in this hotel. We got there early and they let us check in 4 hours before check-in time which was really awesome! All staff were friendly, helpful, and very accomodating. Our room was clean and was always well-kept our entire stay and I would definitely come back and stay here again.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: A wounderful stay, we era able to check in early (7:00 am) and they secured our bags after check out so we could do some more sight seeing. Very friendly staff.

review.title: Good deal!
review.reviewText: This Marriott was conveniently located. Staff were friendly. It was a much better deal than the Bed and Breakfast where we stayed the last time we were in San Francisco, especially considering the Expedia package discount.

review.title: Close to lots of things!
review.reviewText: Comfy hotel 2 blocks from Fisherman's wharf. Close to lots of restaurants, cable car (powell-hyde line), etc.. Would go back.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: we are glad that we selected this hotel as it was in close proximity to a number of attractions & they went above and beyond to ensure we had a memorable stay by delivering a compimentary wine and a cheese platter to our room on my birthday.

review.title: Excelent Hotel !!!!!! The best brand Marriot
review.reviewText: Excelent location, Excelent hotel, Excelent Staff. For a 4 nights trip and the first time in San Francisco was more than we expected. Very close to all the attractions, very confortable bed, very friendly staff, we just love it !!! Tnks !!!

review.title: Service with a Smile
review.reviewText: Staff was friendly and accomodating. Hotel was in a great location, reasonably priced, clean, and comfortable.

review.title: Excellent Location, Comfortable and Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: What else can I say, great location, very close to Fisherman's Wharf and the Trams. The staff were very friendly and assisted in booking all I wanted to see and do. Would highly recommend this hotel to friends and family.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good location a block from Fisherman's Wharf. Beds are very comfortable.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: Very happy with this place...Great location, clean and roomy

review.title: So-So
review.reviewText: The mandatory parking garage was so expensive. It's enough to not want to go back. The hair dryer did not get hot and the coffemaker leaked.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location to fishermans wharf. As a family we felt it was clean safe and convenient. One drawback, the rooms were too small to accomodate a roll away

review.title: Not as expected
review.reviewText: The double bed we had requested had not been provided to us for our entire stay at the hotel.

review.title: very nice, easy walk to warf
review.reviewText: very nice easy access, thank you

review.title: Great central location
review.reviewText: As a family of four visiting San Francisco for the first time, this hotel was in a perfect location. It was a two minute walk from Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square and many wonderful restaurants. The front desk service was exceptional as was the concierge. My only complaint was the room seemed quite small for a family of four.

review.title: Hesitate to stay again
review.reviewText: The only comment is the overall attitude of the staff. Only one or two at the front desk was provide a standard hospitality service. The smiling was real missing and valet parking was not willing to help especislly when I back to hotel at 1 a.m. in the morning. All staff had no greeting words such as good morning, good evening.

review.title: i will go back to this hotel.
review.reviewText: the best hotel.

review.title: Good hotel, but a bit pricey
review.reviewText: The prices for the room itself were good, but the cost for parking and meals were about 20% more than I expected from the quality of hotel.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We got to the hotel 3 hours early before check-in time and a room was already available so we got to check-in as soon as we get there. Concierge staff were very efficient,friendly and helpful. Room and bathroom are very clean, beds very comfortable. Hotel is just few blocks from cable cars and nice restaurants, and short distance to Pier 39.

review.title: Absolutely Brilliant
review.reviewText: Spent a 14night holiday in this hotel and could not have wished for a better place. So central for everything, a short walk and you are amongst main attractions. The staff were brilliant, started off as strangers and ended up as friends, were so polite and helpful, always had a smile for you. If we go back to san francisco would definately book this hotel again.

review.title: Parking Fees
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice but $50 a day to park a car is crazy!

review.title: Too noisy, too outdated
review.reviewText: For the price, this hotel cannot compete with its neighbors. Our bed was simply an old king sized matress with a ill fitting feather down cover on it. The room was small and noisy. The maids forgot to clean out the trash cans from the guests the night before. Staff was very friendly and helpfull.

review.title: Near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel was near many of excursion opportunities and fun things to do.

review.title: Great hotel, great location.
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed my stay at the Marriott Fisherman's Wharf. Really nice comfortable room. Staff was very kind and helpful. Location is perfect, just a couple of blocks to Pier 39, Cable Car,Chocolate, and great restaurants.

review.title: BEAUTIFUL HOTEL CLOSE TO FISHERMAN'S WHARF
review.reviewText: We would definitely stay at this beautiful hotel again. The staff were friendly and very helpful. You are within a block of Starbucks, Dennys and Wal-greens (for items you forgot). About 3 blocks from Pier 39 but there are restaraunts all along the way to eat at.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great Hotel. Quality service and is near everything. Was able to walk to almost all the places i wanted to see.

review.title: One of the nicest hotel ever
review.reviewText: I was impressed with the statement on the internet when looking for the place w planned to stay. This was a family trip with our two boys (first in about 20 years). We went to San Francisco to watch a 49'ers game and revisit Fishermans Wharf. On the internet it said the Marriott was only two blocks from the Fishermans Wharf and it was. Thank you very much Expedia.

review.title: A magnificant hotel close to Pier 39, the cable car and the F line trams.
review.reviewText: An amazing hotel, with the only criticism being that the beds were too soft and "feathred", no good for those with bad backs or allergies. Apart from this it was a superb hotel in every other respect.

review.title: Good stay at the Marriott
review.reviewText: They were able to book adjoining rooms. The concierge was very helpful. The staff was attentive. Rooms were clean and comfortable. On the downside, $40 per night for parking was unreasonable for guests to have to pay.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We spent 8 days and felt that the staff were very warm, responsive and helpful. A nice hotel, slightly older and "worn" but then aren't we all. I would return in a heartbeat.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Location is ideal for touring the city.

review.title: Staff was very friendly
review.reviewText: Concierge had some helpful tips

review.title: Excellent service
review.reviewText: I left a pair of shoes at the hotel when I checked out and they were returned to my home in Canada via UPS within two days. This sort of exceptional service typified my stay at the Marriott. Highly recommended.

review.title: Friendly service
review.reviewText: Very friendly service, great location, clean

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: We would return to the Marriott @ Fisherman's Wharf if we came back. I liked the location best. We walked to the Wharf, China Town and North Beach, where they were shooting a Christmas movie with Vince Vaughn and Reese Weatherspoon. The street was blocked off and we could look out the restaurant window and view them filming a cable car scene. The restaurant prices were sky-high so we found local eateries for breakfast and lunch. For dinner we tried the varied styles that San Fran. offers and we did not have a bad meal or pay exhorbitant prices. All within walking distance or with the use of the transportation system of the city, right outside the hotel door. We met our son, who just got out of the Peace Corps after 27 months, and I couldn't be happier with the hotel or the city.

review.title: Anniversary trip to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Attentive, helpful hotel staff. Champagne and chocolate-covered strawberries, courtesy of the manager, appeared in our room, gratis. The hotel staff provided us with adequate maps of local running and bicycle trails - we walked from the hotel to Sausalito - over the Golden Gate - for lunch on a beautiful, sunny day. Breath-taking views of the Bay, Alcatraz, Angel Island and San Francisco. Competent concierge - made all of our dinner reservations.

review.title: good location, disappointing hotel
review.reviewText: While the location is great, this hotel could use a makeover.

review.title: Marriott San Francisco Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: hotel very nice would stay there again the next time there.

review.title: Very nice, close to public transport
review.reviewText: Very nice, close to lots of attractions, Fisherman's Wharf. Not far to walk to public transport and the Trolly Cars.

review.title: Will always come back to Marriott at the Warf
review.reviewText: Loved it!!! This was our second stay here and where we'll always come back. All staff were very warm and friendly. The concierge also learned that it way my busband's birthday and sent a bottle of wine with fruit and cheese. Great restaurant and room service and the most comfortable beds ever. Even the maid service was great. If we weren't ready to leave when they came they'd come back later or give us the items we needed if we weren't leaving. Not noisy like other hotel's we've stayed at. Since they allow pets, our little Fifi had a great time too.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: It was in a great location. Close to the wharf. The beds were very comfortable and the staff was very nice and helpful.

review.title: Will stay there again
review.reviewText: Very comfortable. Service is great. Very friendly. Lobby with fireplace and bar. Tasty breakfast buffet. Easy walk to the Wharf, transportation, shopping and food of any kind. Car absolutely not neccessary. Parking $40/day. Hertz Rental right around the corner.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: good location - close to many sightseeing places

review.title: Very Good Hotel Overall
review.reviewText: Recent stay in November was great overall. The service at the hotel was exceptional, as well as the location. The maids did such a fabulous job of cleaning the room and there was no musty smell anywhere. The only negatives were the beds were a little too soft and the top mattress slid off some times. Even on the 3rd floor we could hear the outside traffic in the early AM. One morning we decided to get breakfast at the Starbucks kiosk and although the service was superb the prices were outrageous.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Bedding was all down and very comfortable.

review.title: Very plesant and helpful stafff.
review.reviewText: Within walking distant to Fisherman's Wharf and transportation lines.

review.title: Great hotel let down by noise in room
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were very friendly, especially the breakfast staff and everyone went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. Unfortunately there was a persistent background noise in the rooms that went on all night and the extractor fan in the bathroom did not switch off. We could feel air forcing its way around the main door from the air conditioning in the hallway. The manager tried his best, but despite a room change was unable to resolve the situation. It is a big shame, because it would have got top marks otherwise.

review.title: i recomend
review.reviewText: My stay in the marriot fisherman's Wharf was very impressive, I was satisfied with all their services and was very confortable.

review.title: Feather beds were wonderful.
review.reviewText: The room was small, but clean and comfortable. I loved the feather beds/comforters. The refrigerator in our room didn't work, but the hotel maintenance sent someone right up to fix it for us.

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: The Hotel was comfortable and convenient. The Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.

review.title: We will stay there again.....!
review.reviewText: The employees at the hotel... from the ones who managed our luggage to the personal behind the desk and of course the ladies who cleaned our room everyday as if they lived there....! It was a dream vacation come true. Very professional their advise and knowledge of Fishermans Wharf and other areas was wonderful. Their smiles as we were heading out in the morning on a new adventure was inspiring. We thank you....!! The location was great. Two blocks from the bay and close to all the rest of the attractions...! Make sure you take the Segway tour....it was really neat and the guide was so informative. The rooms are first rate the staff will become your friends and you will hate to leave.

review.title: Friendly
review.reviewText: I will go back to stay, all the staff was friendly and helpful.

review.title: Location, Location, Location
review.reviewText: We booked through Expedia (2 adults (mid 50's and one 17 year old) and had requested Expedia ensure there were 2 beds. Unfortunately,the hotel didn't get that message and because it was Fleet Week (ie very crowded and this hotel and many others were sold out), they weren't able to help us out on the first night (we had a cot). However, the next day, the hotel found us a very nice room with two beds, moved all of our gear while we were out and we enjoyed the next two nights we were there. The staff were great, the hotel has a well equipped fitness room and there is a free guest laundry. The location was ideal-close to Fishermans Wharf to be able to rent bikes and walk around conveniently and easy walking up Columbus Avenue to Little Italy and good dining choices, and close enough to taxis, trams and the train to get to downtown. Two years ago in September, we stayed at a hotel on Nob Hill and while the bar at the top has a spectacular view, there was more uphill walking which is ok to a point. We prefer the location of the Marriot as a base as we are quite active and love SF for its biking and running. We did notice that over the last two years, the room prices in SF had increased significantly and even though we didn't have the challenge of a poor Canadian dollar to contend with this time, the prices were steep (apparently we're not supposed to mention rates or other hotels by name).

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Marriott for 3 nights and we certainly enjoyed our experience. The staff was really nice and the bed very comfortable. For us the greatest thing about this hotel was the location. Not only it's close to all attractions, but also offered easy commute to other areas in San Francisco. On our first day we went to a Giants game, and all we had to do was catch the bus right in front of the hotel to go to the stadium.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Cab fare from the airport was $42.00 but it was a good ways away. It's 3 blocks from the cable car stations and 3 blocks from the warf.... a great place... No pool or jacuzzi, but the feather top beds are the softest in San Francisco. The Starbucks coffee in the room is the best to wake up with.... all in all, I would go back to this hotel in a minute....

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel, its location, rooms and staff were lovely. We had never been to San Francisco, so took a chance and booked this hotel and we were delighted with our choice. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable and always willing to help. We had a slight problem with our toilet and they sent engineering right up to fix it. Would stay at Marriott Fishermans Wharf again in a heart beat.

review.title: satisfied
review.reviewText: Very comfy beds. We were always greeted upon entering or leaving hotel. The valet men were very nice and helpful. Free map of San Francisco we were given was a huge help! In close walking distance to a lot of the major sites, Ghiradelli Square, Fisherman's Wharf, Alcatraz, Lombard Street. Have to say the parking is outrageous, but you can't find much cheaper at the surrounding hotels. There is a all night parking garage on Beach that is cheaper. Also the toilets flushed so loud! Really enjoyed our stay!

review.title: Hotel ok. A little run down. Nice staff.
review.reviewText: Kinda expensive but was very convenient to the Fisherman's Warf. Hotel room was a little worn. No view except for the rock garden. Gym was nice. People there were friendly to our little kids. We would stay there again but there are better choices that are cheaper.

review.title: Great location but dont forget your coat.
review.reviewText: Glad we choose the Marriott at Fishermans Wharf and not our other option in Union Square as that was and shops, hussle and bustle not what we wanted for our holidays. Fishermans Wharf is a great location and you can get to all the major attractions easily, the only thing that surprised us was that cos it is by the sea the wind factor made it a bit chilly in the evenings. Thats why you see coats for sale outside every shop, but that said we loved the place and would defiantly recommend it to everyone.

review.title: excellent choice
review.reviewText: The beds were terrific; soft and comfortable. I usually have sore hips from sleeping in a different bed, but not at the Marriott! The rooms were exceptionally clean and housekeeping was very polite and thorough. The location of this hotel is the best. Two trolley lines are about 2 block either way from your hotel and the train that runs along the peirs are one block down from hotel.

review.title: fun family vacation
review.reviewText: very easy access to everything fun in san fransisco.no need for a rental car.great room service for early breakfest or late night snack.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: close to everything. down featherbed wonderful.

review.title: Get Pampered
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Marriott on Fisherman's Warf was phenomonal!!! All the little services that make you feel pampered and taken care of were extended to us. The staff was extremely friendly and courteous. Our room was immaculate and full of ammenities that made our stay ejoyable. We were in and out of the hotel multiple times a day. Each time we entered and exited we were greeted in a personal way by the staff. It was definitely our home away from home. We would definitely choose The Marriott again. Thanks for making our vacation a time to relax and enjoy!!!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great, friendly staff!

review.title: Wonderful service great location
review.reviewText: I just want to thank expedia for making the right choice for my family. We were so happy with our hotel stay. The service was wonderful the rooms were clean. Everyone at the Marriott San Fransico treated us so nice. They made our little get-away everything we hoped it would be. We would reccomend this hotel hands-up. Thank from the central coast.

review.title: Wonderful hotel if you want close to Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: This is a wonderful place to stay - great location, very clean rooms, and most caring and dependable staff. My family had a wonderful vacation and this hotel was the best. I highly recommend it. Yes, the beds were soft with the pillow top down feather toppings but they felt great after walking up and down the SF hills all day long! You won't be disappointed.

review.title: good place to stay
review.reviewText: Location, Location, Location. Marriott is located in heart of all the Fisherman's Wharf Activities. Transportation is a plus, easy to get around. hotel staff go out of their way to make your stay a pleasant one.

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was quite pleasant and the staff was great. However there were a couple of things that could use improvement. One the mattress was too soft. Even though they have a nice feather mattress pad the actual mattress needs to be much firmer. Woke up each morning with a bad backache. The only other thing was the whistle blow (for cab service) outside our window all day and evening was a bit anoying. Perhaps there could be a quieter way to call a cab.

review.title: Clean, comfortable, easy access to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The location is very good - easy access to both Fisherman's Wharf, and, being on Columbus Ave., is within walking distance to the nice variety of Italian restaurants. We stayed in two different rooms (one night at the beginning and one night at the end of our trip). Both rooms were clean and comfortable and reasonably sized, the lobby was exactly what you'd expect for a Marriott; the only down-side was that the hallways were just a bit musty smelling. The reception staff were helpful and efficient. The concierge was very friendly and helpful when we asked for restaurant recommendations.

review.title: Clean and cozy
review.reviewText: Great hotel and very close to pier

review.title: Very Impressed by the friendly staff, location and cleanliness of the hotel
review.reviewText: Very comfortable and conveniently located Hotel. The staff (Hotel and Restaurant) was very friendly and helpful. Nice fitness cente and breakfast buffet was reasonably priced and freshly prepared. Egg white omelet was excellent. Be prepared to pay dearly for parking but use the valet service as it is the same cost.

review.title: i will stay there next time i go to SF
review.reviewText: great location. softest bed!!! friendly service. business center very convenient. i loved it.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Good location. You definitely don't need a car here. We had one and paid $40 for the first night's parking before finding a cheaper one ($26) nearby. Extremly comfortable beds. There is no mini bar in the room which was a surprise. The bartender in the hotel lounge was extremely unfriendly and discouraged us from visiting there again. We got excellent advice from the concierge who seemed really onto it. Great holiday all round.

review.title: Great location. Great service
review.reviewText: I enjoyed this place very much!! I would definitely stay there again!

review.title: good value
review.reviewText: Good value for your money. Good location. Close to many tourist attractions.

review.title: Quality hotel
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with the service , the dining room, the quality of food and mostly the luxury of the beds. The feather tick mattress and the feather duvet and 7 pillows. What a wonderful stay. The staff was friendly and helpful. Would stay there again in a heartbeat!!

review.title: Very attentive staff. Service was number one priority.
review.reviewText: Rated 4 plus

review.title: When business luxury counts
review.reviewText: This is a very affordable hotel with top of the line amenities. The beds are simply the most plush comforting beds, expecially after a hard day in the board room or after a day full of sightseeing. The garidelli (?)chocolate left on the pillow after the staff turn down your bedding is a special an unexpected treat. The staff truly live up to Marriotts new tag line of "Whatever it Takes" just ask and each and every employee there will do whatever it takes to make your stay the best. And no my last mane is not Marriott.

review.title: The only place to stay when at the wharf in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: This was a very nice hotel inside and out. The room was in perfect condition when we first walked in and was immediately cleaned when we left for the day. The bathroom is kinda small but it wasnt a deal breaker. The bed was very very soft. It is in perfect proximity to the wharf (3min walk), ghirardelli square (10min walk), cable car stops(5 min walk), and only a 15 minute walk to the alcatraz boats. The area is very clean and safe, we would stay out til after midnight and walk back to the hotel. The hotel is very far from the airport so make sure you book some kind shuttle to and from. It is worth the $15/person one way. When I come back, this is the only hotel i will stay at. Everything good to say about this hotel.

review.title: Great Stay over New Year's
review.reviewText: We had a party of four people and had two rooms. Both were extremely comfortable - especially the beds! We each had king beds with feather beds, down comforters & pillows. The rooms were very quiet (even on New Year's Eve!), we had a thermostat in the room, not an A/C system. We all had great stay and I would definately recommend this hotel if you are staying in SF on Business or for fun. Great location, great service, nice hotel overall.

review.title: Had to leave ... but we will be back!
review.reviewText: Located just two blocks off the water, this was a wonderful place to stay. The staff was very helpful pointing out the various places for us to go and see/eat ... and did we eat. A stand-up comedy club is just one block towards the water, really fun, and Pier 39 was just two blocks from there. Don't miss this experience if you want to be in the Fisherman's Wharf area.

review.title: Great Location at Fisherman's Wharf! Easy Access to Fun!
review.reviewText: The Hotel staff were a pleasure to deal with. The rooms were very comfortable getting great comments by my teenagers! Easy access to the best of San Francisco by foot, cable cars, trolley and bicycle!

review.title: I would go back
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, excellent location

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: I have seen comments where people have complained about having to pay for the breakfast at the hotel (which is expensive) but they failed to mention that you are a 5 minute walk from Fishermans Wharf where there are plenty of places to eat. I definitely recommend this hotel. Rooms were nice, and the bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. If you are going to San Fran, this is a great hotel to think about staying in. If you don't stay here, you need to stay somewhere close to Fishermans Wharf, it is great!

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: The hotel location is perfect for a leisure trip. It is just a couple blocks from the cable cars and the F bus line which will take you to downtown. It is a short walk to Fisherman's Wharf and surrounding shopping and sights. The hotel is older and the rooms could use some updating, but there is a pleasant lobby and bar with a fireplace, piano, and good food/drinks.

review.title: I Will Stay There Again
review.reviewText: The Marriott San Francisco at Fisherman's Wharf is in a great central location. We were able to walk to the wharf, Ghiardelli Square, Union Square, Chinatown. The room was exceptionally comfortable and very clean. The staff was helpful and gave us good information about location attractions.

review.title: Only As A Last Resort
review.reviewText: Having stayed at many hotels throughout the world, this hotel is the least impressive in recent memory. They certainly missed their mark. The room service menu was basic causing me to want to seek a restaurant in town. The breakfast (sausage) came uncooked. The rooms were very small and came with two full size beds not the usual queen size. Between the sheets and the mattress they put a feather or goose down type insert that had me checking out with a sore back. If it's not part of the bed then don't improvise. Better yet, if you're trying to give it a pillow-top feel then just buy that type of bed. Lastly, I took a cab down to Pier 33 and was dropped off. When I had finished my sightseeing tours I waited patiently for a cab to drive by to take me back to my hotel. They were all occupied and I got tired of waiting in the hot sun after about 30 minutes. I telephoned the hotel to see if the could call one for me to pick me up at Pier 33. They instead gave me walking directions back to the hotel.

review.title: Nice, didn't spend much time there
review.reviewText: Not bad

review.title: Enjoyed the Brief Stay
review.reviewText: Overall satisfaction is important and expected. Few hotels can be 100% perfect. We enjoyed our one-night stay. Very gracious staff, comfortable accommodations with reasonable price.

review.title: Well located to attractions on the Wharf
review.reviewText: Although this hotel has been around a long time, it is very well maintained and well located for visits to the Wharf. The new comforters and pillows used now by Marriott are wonderful and give a sense of cleanliness in addition to being very comfortable. We have stayed a many hotels in the Wharf area and would definitely stay at this one again. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant....there are so many great ones to visit in San Francisco.

review.title: i will help you trust me.....
review.reviewText: I love san fransico!! always have always will.The Marriott was a great place to stay, great location to fishermans wharf and pier 39. Food was good at the hotel as well, becareful they close at 11OOpm.And no smoking rooms but there is a smoking stairwell with great views and fresh air for those of you who need a smoke now and then. Starbucks is also 2 blocks away next to walgreens, yummmm!! Enjoy

review.title: Sweet dreams
review.reviewText: This hotel has the best bed I ever had in an hotel . The service was excellent and Hotel very clean. The location is also very good. Transit system is easy . Parking a little much but didn t really care since everything so outstanding.

review.title: San Fran was a blast!
review.reviewText: The hotel is great, I think with a Marriot you'll rarely be totally dissatisfied. The bar was decent, the drinks were stiff, be it with alcohol AND the price, but hey! You're on vacation! For the buck it's great, the beds are SUPER comfortable.. there is a mini bar in your room.. movie access so you can feel like you're going to the movies in your room. Overall a great place to stay without a doubt, also it's a great location WITHOUT being right in the heart of downtown, which gives it a bit of quietness.

review.title: Always enjoy staying at a Marriott
review.reviewText: The hotel was a great place for us to say for our vacation. We love being on Fisherman's Wlarf. So many places to walk and visit. This was not our first time and we enjoyed it even more.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: Exceptional service, cleanliness, assistance

review.title: Great Bed Poor Service
review.reviewText: The room was very clean and the bed was terrific. No in room safe. Hotel staff was friendly & curtious except for the bar personel. Requested "wake up" call for departure morning from the front desk & never got it.

review.title: good spot for tourists
review.reviewText: my wife and I loved the spot that the hotel was in. the The beds are very soft but best hotel beds in the world. avid travelers but the sit down concierge made a trip so much better with his knowledge of EVERYTHING. secret enterprise rent a car 1 block away that allows for cheap parking. feeding lions at the zoo must see along with exploratorium. cobs comedy club 1 blk away has major talent for cheap. the staff was excellent at marriot. no pool or jacuzzi or if its there u wouldn;t know. I would recomend def. this hotel to anyone!!!

review.title: Good Vacation Location
review.reviewText: Very convenient vacation location

review.title: Nice Hotel, Nice Location
review.reviewText: You can't beat the location, right on Fisherman's Warf and a very few blocks away from both areas where the cable car leaves, so you can choose either one and be able to ride the cable car without any problem, the bed was excellent (we had a king size bed) very comfortable, I highly recommend this hotel and If I would go to San Francisco again I would stay there!

review.title: San Francisco's best location hotel
review.reviewText: The Marriott hotel is perfectly situated for tourist. Within walking distance from the Wharf and Cable Car station. The hotel itself was clean, comfortable and customer service friendly. The staff was attentive to the hotel guest and very friendly. My only recommendation is to be prepared to pay for the expensive parking fees.

review.title: High quality hotel
review.reviewText: We were in San Francisco two nights. This was a high quality hotel. It was very clean, wonderful beds, good service. They let us leave our car in the garage a couple of hours past the 48 hour period with no charge. Staff very helpful, especially the concierge. Very close to Fisherman's Wharf. The only improvement would be to provide some free services such as free internet in the room, free breakfast, or free coffee in the lobby. There was a charge for absolutely everything.

review.title: most comfortable beds
review.reviewText: If you want to stay at the wharf, this hotel is conveniently located, clean, well run. The concierge and staff were very accomodating. My only complaint is that is was very noisy!! The way the hotel is situated (between two streets which run into each other, there is a windtunnel effect. It sounds as if there is a tornado running through outside the window. Also, there is no insulation between rooms. You can almost hear every word spoken next door. You can almost overlook all of this because the beds were absolutely heavenly. The mattresses as well as the linens and spreads were phenomenal!!!

review.title: Great Location, close to everything
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a great location, you could walk to anything on the wharf, wear comfortable shoes! The beds were wonderful, rooms were quite, staff was very helpful in suggestions on how to get places, the city muni bus is right across the street that will take you all over the city. If your staying for a few days there is a Walgreen's about two blocks away that you can buy drinks/snacks and there is a refrigerator in the room which is nice. We would stay here again if we go back to visit.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice. It is much smaller than the average Marriott, which was nice. The staff was very pleasant and very helpful. They knew the best way to get around to all the hot spots. The hotel is just 2 blocks to the Wharf. We also found the best restaurant just 1 block down from the hotel on Columbus Street, Ciopppinos, great food. I would definately stay here again.

review.title: Good location BUT...........
review.reviewText: Great location but dreary hotel rooms. Rooms were run down with dirty/worn bedspreads. I would stay in another hotel in the area.

review.title: First time in San Francisco and Loved it!
review.reviewText: We are first time visitors in San Francisco and absolutely loved the city and the hotel. This Marriott isnt as grand-looking as others we've stayed at. In fact, it looks like a plain building on the outside, but the lobby and inside is great, its just a smaller scale hotel. Everyone was incredibly friendly, helpful, and pleasant. The hotel is located in a great location. Even though its in Fisherman's Wharf, it is just right off from the hustle and bustle that area has. You are 1 block from major transportation to everywhere in the city, you are 2 blocks from the famous cable cars and Ghiradelli. Everything else is super close, even walking distance, but the transportation system there was amazing. The hotel itself is very well kept, the rooms are average but the beds are fantastic! Its only a 4story building, thus, I would recommend getting rooms on higher floors for a little less street noise. Great place!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Basic hotel room, clean and quit. The building is in the shape of a triangle with elevators only located on one side, resulting in good walk to the far rooms. Great breakfast buffet. All in all a good place to stay. However if you book thru Expedia you can not get Marriott Reward points for the stay.

review.title: Very nice all around
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a near perfect location. An easy walk to all attractions - Fisherman's Wharf, The Cannery, North Beach, Chinatown, etc. The concierge staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room (2 Queen beds) was a little cramped, but comfortable.

review.title: Very positrive experience
review.reviewText: My overall impression was very positive. The general appearance of the lobby and other public areas was comfortable and pleasant. The rooms were an adequate size and very well taken care of. The staff were all eager to help and responded quickly to requests. If you drive, be prepared for the daily parking charge of $38.00.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Location was great...with-in walking distance of everything along the wharf, yet located in a quiet area. Hotel staff was polite, professional, and accommodating. Hotel room was not overly large yet more than adequate, we had 2 adults and a teenager in one room so we were testing the space issue!! The best though are the beds...mega comfortable!!! We walked all day long and to come back to those comfy beds at night was a real treat! We stayed for 4 nights and I wouldn't even research other places if we go again, I would stay there without hesitation.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Chose the Marriott SF based on experience with other locations. For the price the room was too small and lacked the amenities the others had.

review.title: My Wife loved the bed !
review.reviewText: you can easily fall asleep on this nice king size bed in about 30 seconds. One of the most comfortable beds we have slept on in a long while ! Hotel was very nice.Only complaint is that they should be more effecient in cleaning up and picking up trays that are left outside rooms. We saw one for almost 24 hours without pickup..

review.title: would go back again
review.reviewText: very clean, centrally located,close to many attractions

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: This is an average hotel.

review.title: Very conviently close to many tourist spots
review.reviewText: Nice. Luxurious beds were the best part; however there's not much of a view - the hotel is long, but only four stories high.

review.title: Will definetly stay in this Hotel again.
review.reviewText: We stayed at this Hotel for three nights with my Inlaws from Germany, the rooms were very clean and the Beds are a dream to sleep on. The Staff was pleasant and helpful. My only negative point in our stay at the Hotel was, the Lounge Furniture ( COUCH and Chairs ) Upholstery were in need of Repair. Sincerly Eleonore Arnbrister

review.title: Helpful, courteous staff and great location
review.reviewText: I was so impressed with the courteous staff. The room was clean, comfortable and spacious. Location to the wharf was great. Restaurant was a bit expensive and not as tasty as one would hope. A really pleasant stay.

review.title: Best Beds Ever!!!
review.reviewText: I truly enjoyed my stay. Best of all, after a long day of sight seeing, I was able to lay down on the softest, most comfortable bed that I have ever had the pleasure to sleep on. Oh and the rest of the hotel was nice too!

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed for 7 nights and would definitely stay there again. Everyone was so polite and extremely helpful.

review.title: it was great.
review.reviewText: we absolutely loved it. the staff was very friendly and helpful. next time we visit san francisco we will definately stay there again.

review.title: Very convenient!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very conveniently located to Fisherman's Wharf. The room was a bit outdated but the bed was very nice and comfortable.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Hotel was just a short walk to Fishmeman's Wharf, Ghiradellli Square, and the trolley car turn around.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!!!!
review.reviewText: Location is the best. Room is nice and comfortable ( bed and pillows.) However, bathroom is a bit too small.

review.title: Good central location!
review.reviewText: If you're visiting San Francisco and want to enjoy the tourism you definitely have to stay near Fisherman's Wharf. The Marriott was convenient to get to the ferry at the wharf and just as convenient to walk to the North Bank for an authentic italian dinner. The concierge was extremely helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean and the beds very comfortable.

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: Warm and clean. I would go back. Great location.

review.title: Perfect Spot in AF
review.reviewText: We've stayed in several hotels in different locations since our son went to college in SF and this was THE best, hands down. The rooms were wonderfully comfortable with down comforters and feather beds, very quiet (ask for a room NOT on Columbus Ave), and the staff was friendly and helpful. GREAT fitness center to work off the excellent meals in the surrounding restaurants (didn't try the hotel dining but the lobby bar was nice) There's also a Starbucks java spot in the lobby. The location, just a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, Coit Tower, North Beach food & drink establishments and the SF Art Institute was perfect. All in all, it was definitelythe best value lodging we've ever had in SF and I'd give it a two thumbs up!

review.title: It's a winner!
review.reviewText: We picked this hotel because it was close to the Fisherman's Wharf, and because after going on and looking at reports from other visitors and finding they were pleased with it, we went with the Mariott. We weren't disappointed. It was a very nice room with a great comfy bed. It also had people who were willing to help us out with things to do and places to go. We encountered rain and they were great about how to get to places with the least amount of hassle. We signed on for the shuttle to the airport and everything went like clockwork. We would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an exceptional time.

review.title: Would love to go back!
review.reviewText: Extremely nice place, you can walk to any part of Fisherman's and to all of the restaurants. we loved it, but you do have to pay for parking at the Marriott it's not included with the price of the room.

review.title: Great loaction, clean comfortable rooms.
review.reviewText: Great value for the money.

review.title: Nice, no frills
review.reviewText: This Marriott property is located 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. The locale is great as you not only have a plethora of activities to choose from but you are mere minutes away from some of the freshest seafood available. Sure there are plenty of tacky souvenir shops and expensive shops but you can catch the cable cars to the downtown area with no hassle. Also, Grayline Tours and the ferrys are all within walking distance. The hotel itself is good. Rooms were typical but the beds are to die for. Imagine being surrounded in the comfort of down all around - simply heavenly. You have Starbucks coffee in the room, plus there is a kiosk in the lobby. The rooms were clean, not old or worn looking, and the maids were very pleasant and accomodating to your every wish. We had an 'outside' room which meant it faced the street - the window was well insulated and we had no problems with noise, except for the day we were leaving: construction was tearing up the street/sidewalk right below our window. I would have been very irritated had I been staying longer. The hotel staff was very courteous and helpful. The concierge in the lobby willing to make your every wish come true. We didn't dine at the restaurant but it looked clean and well staffed. Also, the bar and lobby were very comfy and inviting. My only complaint was, as a smoker, the entire property is smoke-free.

review.title: Great Fisherman's Wharf Location
review.reviewText: Great central location, 2-3 blocks from the Cannery, Ghiradelli Square, and the cable car lines. Our breakfast waitress, and the hotel concierge were especially friendly and knowledgeable. Really loved the fluffy comforters and pillows. Wonderful stay and would recommend it.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed staying here. The staff was very attentive and helpful. The restaurant is also excellent. Its location near the Wharf is also a big plus.

review.title: Good Place
review.reviewText: It was very comfortable and very well located.

review.title: Perfect Location for San Fran sight seeing!
review.reviewText: Eventhough the Marriott Fisherman's Wharf lacks amenities such as pool & hot tub, the location of this hotel is conveniently located to the light rail system, and is with in walking distance of almost everything you must see in San Francisco.

review.title: Excellent location, wonderful bed
review.reviewText: First room was on the street side, we asked to be moved to a quieter location, no problem. After touring all day we were more than happy with the room. Best bed in a hotel that we've ever had, feather mattress, down comforter, yum! Only ate breakfast in the hotel, buffet was good. They could use new furniture in the lounge. Free internet service, nice but slow.

review.title: Good location and pleasant experience
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the hotel. Excellent location at a good price.

review.title: great place to stay!
review.reviewText: Our family had a great time in San Francisco! The Marriot at Fishermans Wharf is the place to stay! Awesome location! Concierge was the BEST! His recommendations for restaurants were all fabulous. Chinese, Italian, Seafood! Can't wait to go Back!!

review.title: Great hotel to base your San Francisco trip
review.reviewText: All the reviews are right! Great location! Can walk to the Wharf, North Beach, Cable Car pickup, the tours office, Hertz (rent a car for your day trips to Napa, Santa Cruz and return it then you don't have to pay for overnight parking), UPS to ship all the stuff we bought, the bike rental office, etc. Great beds, great conceirge - let them book all your tours/dinner reservations, great staff, breakfast buffet a good deal and good food, bar drinks too expensive.This hotel has everything you need - sundry shop, exercise room, washer you can use, business center - use their PCs for free. We "did" the City and highlight was the bike ride over the GGBridge. But not for small kids - it is pretty rigorous. Do this city in offseason.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText: The location is great (just one block from an In/Out Burger and Fisherman's Warf). There were 4 of us staying in the room and it was big enough for all of us. The beds were extremely comfortable and staff gave us extra towels without complaint.

review.title: Wonderful experience
review.reviewText: We stayed 5 days and 4 nights and had a wonderful experience. Everyone was extremely courteous and helpful. There is a very nice bar in the lobby area with very friendly bar tenders. The room was great and by far the most comfortable bed we have ever had in a hotel (even more comfortable than our own bed at home)- You just sink right in. The location was great, walked to Fishermans Wharf daily with lots of good restaurants conveniently near by. We would definitely stay there again.

review.title: A great Location
review.reviewText: The Mariott is so convienent to the Wharf, that it is literally a block away to some of the best chowder houses, bars and resturants. We have stayed here for our honeymoon, and have made this our home for every anniversary. There is so much to see and do.

review.title: wonderful location
review.reviewText: we had 4 in our party and the hotel was so comfortable and the beds so welcoming we really enjoyed our stay

review.title: Worth a repeat visit!
review.reviewText: Very clean hotel, accommodating staff, good restaurant with great service (super strong coffee), perfect location for sightseeing or getting to tours.

review.title: Great weekend!
review.reviewText: Everyone was very helpful! I teach hospitality and customer service..for a living..and the staff at the hotel certainly measured up. My friend and I had a great time. The rooms were clean, comfortable and the feather top mattress was incredible. I will stay there again on my next trip.

review.title: the best bed ever
review.reviewText: The hotel had a very nice lobby with a seating area by the fireplace. Noise level wasn't bad even though there was a resaurant and bar attached to the lobby. But the beds were the star of the show! Feather beds, feather pillows and the other kind, and a down comforter to complete the set. I slept like a baby and will definatly go back. The consierge in the morning was nearly as personable and helpful as the one when I checked into the hotel but hopefully that was just one person.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: My brother and I stayed at the Marriott Fisherman's Wharf over the Labor Day holiday weekend. We were pleaseantly surprised. This was our first trip to San Francisco and everyone had warned us about staying so close to Fisherman's Wharf (it's a tourist trap....too crowded and noisy....tacky, etc...). But the hotel was located just far enough from the crowds and noise yet within walking distance from just about everything. We were surprised how chilly the location was though, but I hear that's the norm for the late summer, so I just bought a fleece jacket from one of the many vendors in the area, at a very good price. Overall a great hotel in a fun part of the city. I highly recommend the Marriott Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Great location, Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Marroitt on Fisherman's Wharf was wonderful. It is in a great location near restaurants and of course the wharf where all the action happens. We stayed there during 4th of July and were able to see the fireworks from our hotel room. The concierge and staff were very helpful and the room was very comfortable. We will definitely stay there again on our return to San Francisco.

review.title: convenient / safe / clean / helpful employess
review.reviewText: You had 3 females on vacation, so we wanted comfort/safety/and a nice/clean place to place our heads at night. From the walk into the lobby , to calling for a wakeup call, no one seemed put out by any request and they really seemed liked they enjoyed their jobs. If someone enjoys their job, then it makes your stay happier. And as their saying goes "WIT" (whatever it takes). The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, and the employees were great..What more do you want on vacation ?

review.title: Will visit again
review.reviewText: This hotel was a great choice. We were very pleased with the efficient and quick service. Employees were very accommodating and apologetic when we asked to change rooms because of a crying baby in the joining room next door. Our second room was very quiet. We enjoyed the pillow top mattress and comforters on the beds-truly a bonus. The location was perfect for enjoying San Francisco's attractions-restaurants, comedy clubs, cable cars and ferries, etc. Would stay here again and will recommend it to friends.

review.title: Friendly and Helpfull
review.reviewText: This Hotel from the day I step through the doors to the time I left was extremely helpfull in all my needs and questions. The staff was very friendly and curteous...my only complaint is the room I had the bathroom had no counter top and one very small sink...I would reccommend this hotel...

review.title: Excellent value
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location for exploring the wharf area with all of its attractions, restaurants and entertainment. On top of that, this is a great place to stay: friendly staff with great service, clean room and everything worked! We went for a three day getaway, but I would definitely like to stay here as a business traveler.

review.title: Great location. Relatively easy to find. Safe area.
review.reviewText: We were completely satisfied with the hotel and all of the associated amenities. Staff was extremely friendly, great service, very clean accomodations. One caution - be prepared for a $43+ per night fee for keeping a vehicle at the hotel, and there is no other option. This is not an expense that is identified in any literature pertaining to this hotel.

review.title: Very helpful staff, great location ~ convenient!
review.reviewText: This was my first visit to San Francisco. The hotel was really nice, and everyone who worked there was extremely friendly and helpful.

review.title: Great time in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great location if you want to stay by the wharf. We were within walking distance of many popular attractions; Pier 39, Ghiradelli Square, Trolley turnaround, Lombard Street, etc. Also, the featherbed was great!

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: The bed was amazingly soft and the window opened ... minor details, but well regarded features.

review.title: Just What We Wanted!
review.reviewText: My daughter and I went for a few days but wanted to stay longer!  The hotel's lounge, bar, and restaurant were very nice.  The piano and fireplaces were very pleasant additions to the comfortable and lovely furnishings in the lounge.  Every employee we met was pleasant and helpful.  Valet service (for our rental car) was a bit pricey but a real treat!  Good location!

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: One of the better hotels I have stayed at. Would recommend it to all my friends. Close to the Waterfront.

review.title: They take seriously..."WIT" (whatever it takes) - customer-driven
review.reviewText:
Our party of four spent five nights. We were treated
with courtesy and the staff were very accomodating. Concierge was very helpful in tour arrangements. Hotel has a very adequate fitness center, which includes sauna and washer and dryer.

review.title: Featherbeds!!!!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: Here I was in San Francisco and i didn't want to get out of bed!!  The featherbeds were fantastic after a day of non stop sightseeing and walking.  We are taking my parents to San Fran in Jan 2006 and i have already told them we are staying at the Marriott!!

review.title: NOT BAD but the design of the hotel is not that great.
review.reviewText: had to walk a long way to the elevator.  around and around

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We stayed 4 nights over New Years weekend and had a wonderful experience.  The room was adequate and very clean.  The beds were above usual hotel standards and very comfortable. Location was awesome-within walking distance of many attractions yet far enough away to have some peace and quiet.  Hotel staff was very helpful.  We would recommend this hotel and stay here again.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The Hotel fit our needs perfectly.  Friendly, helpful staff, clean and comfortable.  Only complaint, mattress was too soft.  If you enjoy walking while on vacation, this property is a great location.  Walking distance to the waterfront, North Beach, Trolley, Ghiardelli Square, Chinatown.  We would definitely return.

review.title: Close to all
review.reviewText: This hotel was convienent to all attractions. It was clean and had and elegent lobby. It also had vallet parking in a city with little parking. I would recomend this to other people, we enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Pleasant Expirience
review.reviewText: Service was fantastic, and room was very neat and clean. Valet Parking was a bit expensive at $38.00 per night.

review.title: Very Nice!
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice and extremely comfortable.  It doesn't hurt to be affordable as well!  We enjoyed our stay very much.  We'll be back again withing the next month or so...we found a keeper!

review.title: Very pleasant stay
review.reviewText: The hotel is attractive and well managed. Our room was pleasant and the king bed extremely comfortable. Only one problem--cleaning staff too efficient! Reading hard-cover book in bed, put it down to dress & go to breakfast. Returned an hour later to find room all cleaned up, book nowhere to be found. Had sheets changed that day. Believe book was swept up in the bedclothes. Front desk synpathetic but not helpful.

review.title: Great Location.... It's a Marriott...
review.reviewText:
First of all, don't expect a "San Francisco" ambiance here. Inside the hotel, you won't have a clue what city you are located in...it's a Marriott hotel. Very nice, large room. We arrived at 1AM local time and the overnight staff was a bit brief. However, the people during the day were great. The front desk and concierge were very pleasant and helpful. It was an easy walk to the wharf and other locations. Next time we may stay closer to Union Square just to make it an easier walk to nerby locations.

Probably the only complaint would be the restaurant. It's a bit pricy and limited in menu. Breakfast buffet is good. We ate dinner there once (a lot of rain and we had just returned from an 11 hour tour). Virtually no one there. Good news is that there are *TONS* of good restaurants within 5 minutes of the hotel. If you want to be in Fisherman's Wharf, it's a good choice...

review.title: Marriot Fisherman's Whart
review.reviewText: This hotel was lovely.  Food was better in North Beach - just take the 30 bus right outside the door. But, the buffet breakfast was rather yummy. We used the sauna almost every night and the dryer as it was raining. So these features were very good for our family. Room service was either too early or too late, though thorough. Location was excellent to everything at the Wharf and nearby and buses!

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText:
The Marriot was a perfect location for a first stay in San Francisco.  It is only few blocks from the Wharf, the Cannery, and Ghiradelli Square and cable car connections.
The staff was friendly and accomodating. 
I hated to return to my own bed as their feather bed was so comfortable!

review.title: GREAT PLACE TO STAY
review.reviewText: We were here thanksgiving 2003, and returned in 2004. We could possibly return in 2005.

review.title: Wonderful Wharf Experience
review.reviewText: I had originally picked this hotel because of its location.  We wanted to be close to Fisherman's Wharf so we wouldn't have to rent a car in the city.  We were able to walk three blocks and be in the epicenter of all the tourist activities the Wharf has to offer.  Plus, our sightseeing tours office was only a block away.  The hotel was beautiful, the beds were super-comfortable, the restaurant had excellent food, and it was wonderful to come back every night after a long day of activities and be welcomed by all the staff.  We will definitely stay there on future vacations.

review.title: perfect locale
review.reviewText: wat can you say San fran is a awesome city.

review.title: Marriott Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Good, clean, basic hotel with good service and amenities, like a 24 hour gym and sauna. Prices at the restaurant are a bit high, but there are plenty of places to eat down on Columbus or in Chinatown. Great location. Parking rates are outrageous at the hotel ($38 a day), but you can find on-street parking except on weekend evenings when it's more difficult. Also, watch out for Tuesday and Thursday nights, when the streets get cleaned at around 2am so overnight parking on the street is not allowed. It's a fairly quiet yet central location but the walls are thin, so beware!

review.title: Marriott, Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel was execllent, the staff was freiendly, courteous and efficient.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Recommended to stay
review.reviewText: Hotel workers were very friendly and efficient.  Except for the high price, I would highly recommend this hotel.  It's close to all the attractions of Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is in the perfect location to enjoy Fisherman's Warf

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: I stay at over 50 hotels a year. This is a fine hotel, near Fisherman's Wharf. Boutique size makes it more enjoyable than some of the very large hotels in the Union Square area.

review.title: Peace and Quite
review.reviewText: It was pretty good concidering the rest of the hotels in the area where having a strike. I was glad that Mariott was not one of them.
